title: Entry Level, Full Time Field Representative
description:
**Organizer– CADC, LLC**

***An Organizer is a full time, entry level position assigned to work on behalf of a Democratic or political advocacy organization. Organizers help engage residents and voters about the most important political issues and candidates represented by CADC.***

**Organizer Responsibilities** 

*Business & Community Outreach* 

* Organizers will conduct outreach to small businesses, community stakeholders, local organizations, or residents
* Organizers will be responsible for disseminating information vital to the campaign’s goals in a variety of spaces
* Organizers can further the campaign’s goals by identifying and recruiting volunteers and participants to join in campaign actions

*Structure & Reporting* 

* Organizers will report to a Regional Field Director and/or Deputy Regional Field Directors. Organizers will be receiving priorities and assignments from their direct supervisor on a daily basis
* Organizers will be responsible for communicating their progress to goals to their direct supervisor in a clear and concise manner
* Organizers will be expected to provide canvassers, volunteers, and supporters with accurate information, clear guidance on campaign participation, and positive support at all times

*Canvasser Recruitment & Management* 

* When applicable, Organizers will assist in all canvasser recruitment activities and ensure that recruitment goals are achieved throughout the duration of the program
* Providing canvassers with the positive leadership culture, resources, guidance and technical support required to succeed during each phase of the program
* Ensuring all canvass shifts are launched and completed in a timely, orderly fashion
* Promoting the continued development of canvassers in their day-to-day duties and responsibilities over the course of the program

\\*Other duties may be assigned

**Desired Skills and Experience** 

*Skills* 

* A strong dedication to progressive values
* Deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* An understanding and appreciation of the urgent nature and time demands of campaigns

*Experience* 

* Computer proficiency is required
* Campaign experience and proficiency with VAN is a plus
* Management or supervisory experience is a plus
* Customer Service experience a plus

*Miscellaneous* 

* Willingness to work long hours and weekends
* A valid driver’s license, reliable transportation and the ability to relocate as needed.
* Working laptop
* Candidates with retail, customer service, hospitality, restaurant, sales, education, human services, administrative, door to door, uber, lyft, and door dash experience are all encouraged to apply

*Compensation and Application Submission* 

* This position is full-time, hourly wage position
* Application Deadline: Hiring Immediately
* CADC, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer

*CADC, LLC is seeking qualified, highly motivated individuals to fill the role of Organizer. Organizers serve an important role on the front lines of today’s progressive fights, and organizer experience is vital to any seeking a career in politics.*

*CADC specializes in direct voter contact and community outreach on behalf of progressive candidates and causes. CADC’s leadership has decades of combined experience with campaigns of all shapes and sizes, from Presidential campaigns, the DSCC and DCCC, national issue advocacy campaigns, and municipal races.*

*Organizers are responsible for conducting the day-to-day outreach on behalf of the campaigns and organizations CADC represents.*

*Applicants for the position should possess strong organizational and communication skills as well as the ability to multitask and meet deadlines. Applicants should be willing to relocate as necessary. Applicants must possess reliable transportation, a valid driver’s license, working laptop, and be willing to work extended hours and weekends.*

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary, Seasonal

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 48 per week

Benefits:

* On-the-job training

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* No nights

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Afterschool Assistant Program Director (PS 214 Elementary: Grades K-5)
company: South Bronx Overall Economic Development Corp. (Sobro)
description:
Job Description

**JOB TITLE:** ASSISTANT PROGRAM DIRECTOR

**REPORTS TO:** Program Director (Site Coordinator)

**DEPARTMENT:** School-Based Programs

**POSITION**: PART TIME (20HRS-25HRS WKLY)

**SALARY:** $18 - $22 PER HOUR

The SoBRO Center for Education and Career Development offers successful, exciting, cutting-edge programs for youth and adults. The Center’s mission is to engage youth, adults, and family groups in career exploration, leadership development, educational and employment opportunities to achieve economic independence. SoBRO is seeking skilled and dedicated individuals with strong commitment to enhancing the quality of life in the South Bronx by providing innovative, outcomes-based activities.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Works in collaboration with the Program Director in the oversight of program design and implementation of Neighborhood Development Area program for school-age children

· Responsible for recruitment and retention of participants

· Responsible for the evaluation of one staff member

· Supports staff to access the tools and equipment they need to do their jobs, as well as monitoring the environment for health and safety hazards.

· Assists with contract management in accordance with funder requirements, DOE, DOH, and applicable labor laws

· Perform performance evaluations for the staff to ensure the program maintains a high level of quality and reports to Program Director on staff strengths and challenges.

· Creates and distributes schedule of all activities and ensures appropriate record keeping and reporting of all youth attendance via DYCD database

· Prepares and distributes written materials, including flyers, brochures, newsletters, and posting on the school bulletin board.

· Helps in organizing special and culminating events, including showcases that highlight student achievement and culturally enriching field trips

· Assist Program Director with parent engagement, as well as involvement with their children’s education.

· Second liaison to the school principal and administration, as well as collaborate with the Program Director in the program delivery.

· Required to collect data, and archive the data DYCD database

· Established partnerships with community organizations to enhance the programming.

· Establish and Maintain core relationships with community organizations, school administration, peers and families

· Perform other duties as assigned by the Program Director/ Supervisor

**Job Qualifications and other Requirements:**

· Associates Degree Preferred (Other acceptable fields include recreation, social work, program administration, psychology and sociology)

· At least three years of direct experience working with children under the age of 13 years, including two years in a supervisory capacity

· Exceptional interpersonal, and superior written and oral communication skills

· Must have the ability to demonstrate and/or show competency in the following areas of Youth Development principles, College and Career Exploration, social-emotional learning activities

· Ability to create interactive academic and/or enrichment activities that are age-appropriate

· Ability to make sound decisions to secure the safety and wellbeing of all program participants. · Experience and cultural competent in working with under-served populations

· Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Outlook, and Word

· Able to work independently and in an interdisciplinary team, as required

· Solid conflict management skills

· Working a flexible schedule to meet program staffing/planning needs

· Ability to exercise mature judgment and make sound decisions to secure the safety and wellbeing of all program participants

· Experience overseeing program evaluation and utilizing data to drive decision making

· Knowledge of NYC DOH/OCFS Part 414 regulations, DOE’s Chancellor’s Regulations and Common Core Standards

· Must have State Central Review (SCR) and Criminal Background clearance prior to employment, as well as maintaining background clearance throughout employment

· Must have Medical Clearance within two weeks of employment

· Bilingual ( Spanish and English)

**COVID-19 On-Site Safety Regulations:**

· All staff must wear a mask or face covering at all times and be prepared to undergo school’s safety regulation upon entering the building daily.

· School or site may require staff to be tested weekly or monthly and you must adhere to continue work at that site location.

· Get familiar with COVID-19 school health policy for programs inside of school buildings

· Promote behaviors that reduce spread such as distancing, wearing face coverings and adhering to signage and floor markings.

· Maintain healthy environment and cleanliness such as keeping hands clean, building space usage and disinfecting all on a consistent basis

· Recognize symptoms and be prepared to report

· Obey COVID-19 school model and regulations and program schedule based on regulations

**Hours**

· School-Year- Monday-Friday, 1:00 p.m. through 6:00 p.m. or 20-25 hours per week

· Holidays and School Breaks Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. through 6:00 p.m. If applicable

· Occasional weekend and evening hours

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* After school
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What is your Availability?

Position requires to be available from Monday through Friday from atleast 12:00pm until 6:00pm, for Summer Camp Monday through Friday atleast 8:00am to 6:00pm. Occasional weekends.

Education:

* Associate (Required)

title: Hart: Long-Term Special Education Paraeducator - General
description:
JobID: 11972  

**Position Type:**  

 Substitute/Per Diem Substitute Paraeducator  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/12/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 09/12/2024  


**The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**POSITION TITLE:** PARAEDUCATOR – SPECIAL EDUCATION (GENERAL)  

  

**PURPOSE:**  

To serve as an integral member of the instructional team to provider services to individual student(s) in accordance with the goals/objectives identified by the Individual Education Plan (IEP).  

  

**SUPERVISION RECEIVED:**  

Certified Staff Professional(s) and/or appropriate Administrator.  

  

**EXAMPLES OF DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

  

**STUDENT SUPPORT DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Work with individual students or small groups of students, under the supervision of a certified teacher, to reinforce learning of materials or skills initially introduced by the teacher.
+ Collect data on student progress, under the direction of the teacher, for individual students or groups of students.
+ Follow student schedule(s), as written by certified staff, i.e. administrators, teachers, related service providers, etc. and seek clarification as needed.
+ Assist the teacher in the handling, operation, and care of equipment used in the classroom, including media and instructional materials.
+ Assist with the supervision of students during emergency drills, assembles, play periods, field trips, and in other non-classroom activities.
+ Support with implementation of goals and objectives (IEP) as assigned by certified staff, and maintain strict confidentiality of the same.
+ Foster independence in students through implementation of Independence goal(s) and other strategies
+ Assist with daily living needs, such as feeding and bathroom accommodations.
+ Assist with organization and on-task behavior
+ Implement behavior intervention plans under the direction of a certified staff member.
+ Serve as the chief source of information and help to any substitute teacher assigned in the absence of the regular teacher.
+ Assist with implementation of Health Care plans for students and other medical needs.
+ Alert the teacher(s) regarding any problem or special information related to an individual student.
+ Help students master equipment or instructional materials assigned by teacher.
+ Assist other students in an inclusion classroom.

**GENERAL/ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Participate in professional development training programs, as required.
+ Perform other related duties, as assigned.
+ Maintain the same high level of ethical behavior and sensitivity of information about students as is expected of a certified teacher.
+ Exhibit a clear understanding of the IEP information as it pertains to their role as an implementer.
+ Distribute and collect workbooks, papers, and other materials for instruction as needed.


  

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:**
+ Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
+ Demonstrated ability to understand and follow oral and written instructions effectively.
+ Exhibits proficiency in basic reading, math, writing, and speaking English.
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to work productively with children.
+ Appropriate reading, spelling, writing, and math skills to support student.
+ Physical condition commensurate with the demands of, at a minimum, the essential functions of the position.
+ Must exhibit good judgment, patience, tact, and courtesy.
+ Utilizes and maintains ethical practices for confidential communication about students.
+ Ability to establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships.


  

**MINIMUM Qualifications:**
+ Must follow the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) requirements and have passed the ParaPro Assessment, hold an Associate’s Degree, or have completed at least 60 credits at an approved college
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to support any specialized programs for Special Needs students, including support of behavioral plans, strategies for autism or other identified diagnoses, or support for treatments such as ABA or activities of daily living such as feeding and toileting.
+ Experience/training in working with children preferred.
+ Comfort with use of standard computer applications.
+ Such additions and alternatives to the above qualifications as may be appropriate and acceptable.


  

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**  

Environment:+ The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This will include indoor office/classroom settings, outdoor play, recreation areas and field trip locations.


  

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.+ While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time to view & operate computer equipment, and to stand for extended periods of time to assist student(s) and/or staff.
+ The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit, bend, stoop and kneel.
+ The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms.
+ The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds.
+ Specific vision abilities required by this job include vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
  

  

  

**COMPENSATION:**$102 Per day  

  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.

title: Julia A. Stark: Long-Term Substitute Multimedia Specialist - Elementary
description:
JobID: 11971  

**Position Type:**  

 Substitute/Long-Term Substitute Teacher  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/12/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 09/12/2024  


**The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

**General Statement:**  

Stamford Public Schools continues on its journey to seamlessly integrate technology into our curriculum, aiming to enrich student learning experiences, foster engagement, promote equity, and equip students for the dynamic demands of modern learning and professional environments. In continual pursuit of this goal, we are dedicated to assembling a team of **Multimedia Specialists - Elementary**. The **Multimedia Specialist - Elementary** implements the multimedia curriculum, oversees the management of library and technology inventory, and provides technology integration support. This role entails a diverse set of responsibilities, including enhancing teacher and student capabilities in multimedia and software utilization, supporting standardized testing, managing hardware and media center inventory, providing troubleshooting assistance, ensuring the smooth operation of instructional technology systems, participating and delivering professional development, and collaborating closely with central office and the City of Stamford IT personnel.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ **Teaching:**
	- Teach principles of computer science as outlined in the district curriculum.
	- Teach principles of digital citizenship, device use, and online safety as outlined in the district curriculum.
	- Teach and model developmentally appropriate book selection skills.
	- Teach students the use of academic software applications (i.e. Google Suite, Canva, Adobe Express, Destiny, etc…).
+ **Technology Integration and Support:**
	- Assist in the coordination and delivery of professional development activities directly related to the integration of technology in all content areas.
	- Design, implement and support learning opportunities for teachers intended to build capacity and expertise in the use of instructional technology.
	- Assist teachers through peer coaching, modeling, and mentoring on effective instructional technology teaching strategies.
	- Help teachers develop curriculum materials and specific lesson plans to utilize technology in the classroom.
	- Develop and provide training for staff, parents, and students on the use of educational technology including Chromebooks, laptops, and a variety of other educational software and devices.
	- Create learning resources for teachers, staff, and students. These may include Web sites, tutorials, interactive programs, and databases that support teachers in integrating technology.
	- Submit a monthly report on technology professional development, training and support activities provided to school staff.
	- Support district curriculum development in embedding technology into the curriculum, administering district assessments, and analysis of instructional data.
	- Support with the collection and analysis of data as well as the organization and administration of standardized assessments.
	- Support school-based staff in their use of the District’s Student Information System (SIS) related to: scheduling, reports, gradebook, data exports, and data analysis.
+ **Oversee the Technology Program for the School:**
	- Assist with general hardware and software support and troubleshooting for all technology equipment at the school.
	- Work with the City of Stamford IT, central office, and school-based staff to maintain all instructional technology.
	- Collaborate in the evaluation, selection, and implementation of instructional technology equipment, materials and software.
	- Document and maintain an up to date inventory of all devices and technology equipment in assigned school including all appropriate licensing information.
	- Log, monitor and update device service requests in a work order management database.
	- Assist with verifying device repairs have been completed successfully.
	- Coordinate distribution and collection of devices at the start of the school year.
	- Manage building-based software licenses and applications that support classroom instruction as needed.
	- Manage and maintain school website, including creating, updating and editing website content.
	- Assist with the administration of district and state assessments by allocating devices and supporting the training of teachers in assessment administration procedures.
+ **Oversee the Library Media Center:**
	- Make all materials easily accessible to students and teachers.
	- Assist teachers and students with choosing and finding appropriate library materials.
	- Catalog new books in Destiny Library Manager.
	- Maintain and repair library materials.
	- Organize and train parent volunteers.
	- Shelve new and returned books and other library materials in an organized manner.
	- Coordinate and facilitate Linked Libraries program with the Ferguson Library.
	- Create and maintain an inviting space and inventory which encourages and supports literacy.
	- Collaboratively work with the TOSA for Technology to edit and update the library media collection.
+ Perform other duties as required.


  

+ Estimated Time Allocations:
+ 60% Teaching (teaching limit is 0.6 FTE / 16 classes per week with up to 1 collateral duty per day.)
+ - Collateral duty must not be during arrival.
	- Collateral duty must not be during dismissal during the bi-weekly afterschool meeting time.
+ 20% Managing hardware and software. Training and assisting teachers, students and parents in the use of software and hardware.
+ 20% Managing library physical and digital inventory. Managing book checkout during a daily 25 min time slot.
+ Mandatory Bi-weekly meetings on Tuesday from 3:30pm-4:45pm (subject to change).


  

**Physical and Mental Demands, Work Hazards:**  

Works in standard office and school building environments.  

  

**Knowledge and Skills:**
+ Commitment to creating schools that provide an education that cultivates productive habits of mind, body, and heart in every student.
+ Intermediate to advanced technology skills.
+ Experience with learning management systems such as Google Classroom.
+ Experience with inventory management systems such as Destiny.
+ An understanding and familiarity with national, state and local curriculum standards and frameworks.
+ An understanding of key learning theories and methods of instruction and their relation to technology integration.
+ Demonstrated capacity in providing professional development for teachers
+ Demonstrated experience in the integration of technology into the curriculum such as online resources, Google apps for education, digital portfolios, content creation, video creation, and applications to support summative and formative assessments
+ Experience with effective teaching strategies in teaching software and hardware skills
+ Evidence of organizational ability and ability to successfully manage and complete projects.
+ Demonstrated capacity to work well with others
+ Demonstrated strong organization and physical/digital inventory management skillsSuperior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows and Google Chrome); Microsoft Office and Google suites. Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Google Slides, Canva); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Google Meets, Zoom, Microsoft Teams); Accounting Software (i.e. My School Bucks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); Website editing software (i.e. Google Sites, Finalsite) or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.


  

**Qualifications:**
+ CT CSDE Teaching Certification for the appropriate grade levels.
+ 5 years teaching experience, preferred
+ Google Level 1 and Level 2 Certification, preferred
+ Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Technology, or a related technology/computer field from an accredited college or university, preferred. Other relevant experience may be considered.
+ Three years in technology and/or media experience, preferred
+ Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the Superintendent and/or Stamford Board of Education may find appropriate.

**Connecticut State Department of Education Certification:**  

This assignment is expected to continue for more than 40 days, and therefore we are seeking a certified candidate. If you are not currently certified in CT, but hold a Bachelor's degree and 12 credits in the content area to be taught, we will apply to the CSDE for Long-Term Substitute Authorization.  

  

**Long-Term Substitute Teacher Compensation:**  

$155 per day  

  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.

title: Stamford High School: Long- Term Special Education Paraeducator - General
description:
JobID: 11974  

**Position Type:**  

 Substitute/Per Diem Substitute Paraeducator  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/12/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 09/12/2024  


**The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**POSITION TITLE:** PARAEDUCATOR – SPECIAL EDUCATION (GENERAL)  

  

**PURPOSE:**  

To serve as an integral member of the instructional team to provider services to individual student(s) in accordance with the goals/objectives identified by the Individual Education Plan (IEP).  

  

**SUPERVISION RECEIVED:**  

Certified Staff Professional(s) and/or appropriate Administrator.  

  

**EXAMPLES OF DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

  

**STUDENT SUPPORT DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Work with individual students or small groups of students, under the supervision of a certified teacher, to reinforce learning of materials or skills initially introduced by the teacher.
+ Collect data on student progress, under the direction of the teacher, for individual students or groups of students.
+ Follow student schedule(s), as written by certified staff, i.e. administrators, teachers, related service providers, etc. and seek clarification as needed.
+ Assist the teacher in the handling, operation, and care of equipment used in the classroom, including media and instructional materials.
+ Assist with the supervision of students during emergency drills, assembles, play periods, field trips, and in other non-classroom activities.
+ Support with implementation of goals and objectives (IEP) as assigned by certified staff, and maintain strict confidentiality of the same.
+ Foster independence in students through implementation of Independence goal(s) and other strategies
+ Assist with daily living needs, such as feeding and bathroom accommodations.
+ Assist with organization and on-task behavior
+ Implement behavior intervention plans under the direction of a certified staff member.
+ Serve as the chief source of information and help to any substitute teacher assigned in the absence of the regular teacher.
+ Assist with implementation of Health Care plans for students and other medical needs.
+ Alert the teacher(s) regarding any problem or special information related to an individual student.
+ Help students master equipment or instructional materials assigned by teacher.
+ Assist other students in an inclusion classroom.

**GENERAL/ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Participate in professional development training programs, as required.
+ Perform other related duties, as assigned.
+ Maintain the same high level of ethical behavior and sensitivity of information about students as is expected of a certified teacher.
+ Exhibit a clear understanding of the IEP information as it pertains to their role as an implementer.
+ Distribute and collect workbooks, papers, and other materials for instruction as needed.


  

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:**
+ Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
+ Demonstrated ability to understand and follow oral and written instructions effectively.
+ Exhibits proficiency in basic reading, math, writing, and speaking English.
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to work productively with children.
+ Appropriate reading, spelling, writing, and math skills to support student.
+ Physical condition commensurate with the demands of, at a minimum, the essential functions of the position.
+ Must exhibit good judgment, patience, tact, and courtesy.
+ Utilizes and maintains ethical practices for confidential communication about students.
+ Ability to establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships.


  

**MINIMUM Qualifications:**
+ Must follow the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) requirements and have passed the ParaPro Assessment, hold an Associate’s Degree, or have completed at least 60 credits at an approved college
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to support any specialized programs for Special Needs students, including support of behavioral plans, strategies for autism or other identified diagnoses, or support for treatments such as ABA or activities of daily living such as feeding and toileting.
+ Experience/training in working with children preferred.
+ Comfort with use of standard computer applications.
+ Such additions and alternatives to the above qualifications as may be appropriate and acceptable.


  

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**  

Environment:+ The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This will include indoor office/classroom settings, outdoor play, recreation areas and field trip locations.


  

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.+ While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time to view & operate computer equipment, and to stand for extended periods of time to assist student(s) and/or staff.
+ The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit, bend, stoop and kneel.
+ The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms.
+ The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds.
+ Specific vision abilities required by this job include vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
  

  

  

**COMPENSATION:**$102 Per day  

  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.

title: Strawberry Hill: Long- Term Substitute Design Teacher
description:
JobID: 11970  

**Position Type:**  

 Substitute/Long-Term Substitute Teacher  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/12/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 09/12/2024  


**The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

**General Statement:**  

The IB Design Teacher fosters the independence of each student as an International Baccalaureate (IB) learner, effectively assesses student needs and progress reflected through I.B. Middle Years Program (MYP) criterion. The IB Design Teacher is responsible for planning instruction to achieve MYP Design objectives, and implementing long and short-term Design goals. The IB Design Teacher is also responsible for the utilization of MakerSpace equipment and ensuring the MYP Design Criterion are met and assessed as per the International Baccalaureate specifications. The IB Design Teacher accomplishes these goals through effective communication with students, parents, and colleagues. The IB Design Teacher will use the interdisciplinary approach to teaching and learning utilizing the MYP Design criterion within their classroom. MYP Design is one of the eight MYP subject areas, which include: Arts, Individuals and Societies, Language Acquisition, Language and Literature, Mathematics, Physical and Health Education and Sciences.  

  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Demonstrates knowledge and application in the Common Core standards of reading, writing and mathematics as they connect and support the MYP Design criterion.
+ Effectively supports the IB magnet focus as required by International Baccalaureate Organization.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of human growth and development as it relates to the teaching-learning process with a focus on the IB learner profile.
+ Effectively communicates with students, parents and staff.
+ Effectively organizes time, space, materials and equipment for instruction.
+ Effectively assesses student needs and progress.
+ Effectively meets the needs of exceptional students, including ELL strategies.
+ Establishes a positive learning environment.
+ Meets professional responsibilities.
+ Encourages and maintains the cooperative involvement and support of parents and the community in the DSIP and SSIP.
+ Supports professional development within a rapidly evolving area of IT as it connects to MYP Design.


  

**Qualifications:**
+ Connecticut State Department of Education Certification with grade level certification in any subject area.
+ Demonstrated knowledge of applicable Common Core State Standards, Technology Standards and Design Criterion.
+ Must be willing to be trained and acquire the skills required to work effectively in all aspects of IB philosophy focusing on MYP Design.
+ Demonstrated excellence in teaching the subject area(s) and/or instructional levels targeted.
+ Evidence of ability to work cooperatively with administrators, teachers and paraeducators.
+ Evidence of organizational ability and willingness to pursue tasks to successful completion.
+ Superior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.

  

**Connecticut State Department of Education Certification:**  

This assignment is expected to continue for more than 40 days, and therefore we are seeking a certified candidate. If you are not currently certified in CT, but hold a Bachelor's degree and 12 credits in the content area to be taught, we will apply to the CSDE for Long-Term Substitute Authorization.  

  

**Long-Term Substitute Teacher Compensation:**  

$155 per day  

  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.

title: AITE: Long-Term Substitute Social Studies Teacher
description:
JobID: 11969  

**Position Type:**  

 Substitute/Long-Term Substitute Teacher  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/12/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 09/12/2024 **The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

  

**Job Description** – Social Studies Teacher  

  

**General Statement:**  

A competent **Social Studies Teacher** understands growth and development, demonstrates knowledge of what is to be taught and facility in the basic skills and helps students to develop positive self-concepts. The **Social Studies Teacher** stimulates the independence of each student as a learner, effectively assesses student needs and progress, and plans instruction to achieve selected objectives, including those appropriate for exceptional students. The **Social Studies Teacher** accomplishes these objectives through effective communication with students, parents and colleagues, and through the use of appropriate techniques and materials in a positive climate where time, space and equipment are effectively organized for instruction. In addition, the **Social Studies Teacher** meets professional responsibility for continuing growth and fosters cooperative involvement with parents and the community.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Demonstrates facility in the skills of reading, writing and mathematics.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the subject to be taught.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of human growth and development as it relates to the teaching-learning process.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the American public school system.
+ Plans instruction to achieve selected objectives.
+ Effectively implements instructional plans and uses appropriate instructional techniques.
+ Effectively communicates with students.
+ Helps students develop positive self-concepts.
+ Facilitates the independence of the student as learner.
+ Effectively organizes time, space, materials and equipment for instruction.
+ Effectively assesses student needs and progress.
+ Effectively meets the needs of exceptional students.
+ Establishes a positive learning environment.
+ Meets professional responsibilities.
+ Encourages and maintains the cooperative involvement and support of parents and the community.

**Qualifications:**
+ A valid Connecticut teacher certificate in 026-History & Social Studies, 7-12 or 226-History & Social Studies, Middle School, 4–8.
+ Demonstrated excellence in teaching the subject area(s) and/or instructional levels targeted.
+ Evidence of ability to work cooperatively with administrators, teachers and educational assistants.
+ Evidence of organizational ability and willingness to pursue tasks to successful completion.
+ Superior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.

**Connecticut State Department of Education Certification:**  

This assignment is expected to continue for more than 40 days, and therefore we are seeking a certified candidate. If you are not currently certified in CT, but hold a Bachelor's degree and 12 credits in the content area to be taught, we will apply to the CSDE for Long-Term Substitute Authorization.  

  

**Long-Term Substitute Teacher Compensation:**  

$155 per day  

  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.

title: General Manager
description:
The Amazing Escape Room is looking for General Managers for our Green Brook, New Jersey location. Do you enjoy games, mysteries, and puzzles? Then this job could be for you!

\\*\\*\\*NO ESCAPE ROOM EXPERIENCE NECESSARY

We are looking for candidates who:

* Excel in customer service
* Can make simple repairs
* Can lead a team by example
* Are creative
* Are self motivating

As a General Manager at The Amazing Escape Room you will be required to:

* Maintain excellent customer service
* Hire, Train, and Manage a staff of 10+
* Schedule employees
* Submit payroll
* Manage Inventory
* Maintain location upkeep
* Repair small fixes and communicate on large fixes

You will be expected to work 40 hours a week including most weekends.

The job starts at $40,000 per year with potential for tips and other incentives!

description:
### **About The Role**

**Role:** Kitchen Designer  

  



As an experienced kitchen, home or bathroom designer, you'll use your design skills to help our customers turn their dreams into reality. Using our custom technology, you'll have all the tools needed to lead the development of new business, build lasting customer connections, design dream kitchens, and close sales.  

  



**Compensation:** Enjoy a generous starting salary of $16.83 per hour, with unlimited earning potential through uncapped commissions, paving the way for an impressive OTE of over $100,000 annually.


**What Wren Offers:**


* A full-time position with amazing earning potential through UNCAPPED commission
* Health, dental, and vision benefits
* A great 401K company match
* 15 days PTO and 5 paid sick days
* 7 federal holidays
* Fully paid training

### **About You**

**What you will bring to Wren:**



Enthusiasm and a willingness to learn are vital. Experience in kitchen, bathroom or similar design is preferred, but exceptional candidates with CAD, Design or Commission sales experience are encouraged to apply.  

  

Availability to work 40 hours per week, with some weekend and evening shifts required.### **About The Company**


**Wren Kitchens is expanding and coming soon to locations near you!**

We are thrilled to announce the upcoming launch of new locations in early Fall 2024 and are currently looking for passionate individuals to join our expanding team. This is an excellent chance to be part of our dynamic company's growth and work at one of our state of the art showrooms



At Wren Kitchens, we specialize in offering affordable luxury kitchens, proudly manufactured in the USA. Our mission extends beyond being just a kitchen manufacturer; we understand that the kitchen is the heart of the home, where families gather, meals are shared, and memories are made.



Join us at Wren Kitchens and be a part of our incredible growth story!

title: Director of Human Resources
description:
**Beansprouts is seeking a talented Human Resources Director.**

We have grown children, families and teachers since 1980. Are you looking for a job that is family oriented and meaningful? If so, we invite you to apply today!

Beansprouts has provided high quality childcare services to multiple generations of families for over 40 years in the Park Slope community.

We are looking for an experienced and effective, process-focused Human Resources professional with a history of success in a senior leadership role who can grow along with us. The HR Director will work collaboratively with our Executive Director and Senior Leadership Team. Come join our team of gifted educators and caring professionals who work with an amazing group of children and their families in Brownstone Brooklyn!

**Job Description:**

The HR Director will partner with the executive leadership team to support the operations of Beansprouts and Brooklyn Beans with a positive and collaborative culture. The ideal candidate for this role should possess a strong work ethic, excellent communication skills, strong knowledge of labor regulations and HR practices, strategic thinking abilities, strong organizational skills, and excellent interpersonal skills. The exceptional HR Director should improve and support HR processes, implement strategies that support business growth, measure and help improve morale, employee retention, and job satisfaction, attract the best recruits, and promote the organization's values.

In addition to the skills and experience listed, we are looking for a motivated self-starter who is ready to hit the ground running. Come join us!

Responsibilities include (but may not be limited to):

* Oversee all aspects of HR including onboarding, training and development, performance evaluations, employee relations, and compliance
* Develop long-term strategies and key initiatives to help team members
* Establish new and streamline existing HR processes and oversee HR systems
* Ensure compliance with all human resources and employment regulatory requirements
* Recommend, develop, and implement best practices
* Review, manage, and maintain accurate job descriptions for all positions within the organization
* On-site, 5 days each week

**Qualifications:**

* 7+ years of diverse experience in human resources
* 3+ years experience in a senior HR leadership position
* Bachelor's Degree Required
* Experience with Education and Childcare programs a plus
* Knowledge and understanding of all current relevant Federal, state and local labor and employment laws accompanied by the drive to keep up to date and understand future legislation (with the assistance of external resources)
* Ability to work with and across all levels of the organization, including the capability to diplomatically influence Executive Leadership Team members
* Clear and strategic thinker, with ability to quickly identify root causes of problems and develop creative and strategic solutions
* Very organized and detail-oriented
* Strong and confident interpersonal skills
* Strong judgment and critical thinking skills
* Versatile and willing to contribute to the organization in many ways
* Ability to build relationships with a diverse staff and applicant pool
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills

Pay: $85,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

* Vision insurance

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* Bachelor's (Required)

title: Migrant Resource Navigator(s)
description:
### **Migrant Resource Navigator(s)**


**About NYDIS:**  

New York Disaster Interfaith Services (NYDIS) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit faith-based federation, uniting faith communities, human services providers, and charitable organizations to deliver disaster readiness, response, and recovery services in New York City and Puerto Rico – and, when requested and capable, metro NYC counties.


**Position Overview:**  

NYDIS is seeking full-time Resource Navigators to join a dynamic team supporting asylum-seekers and other eligible populations at municipal Reticketing Centers. As a Resource Navigator, you will be responsible for providing comprehensive resource navigation services, ensuring clients are connected to New York City’s vast network of health, human, and social services. This is a 12–24-month contract position with the possibility of extension, expected to serve approximately 1,400 clients per week.


**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Staff a module at NYC’s Reticketing Center provide ongoing support to eligible individuals.
* Provide onsite guidance on available services, programs, and resources to walk-ups or by appointment.
* Input client data and track resource referrals in online database, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.
* Collaborate team members and report client needs, service gaps, and emerging trends to Supervisors.
* Coordinate with supervisors to help NYDIS revise online resource directory accordingly.
* Stay informed about evolving landscape of services and resources, including legal, healthcare, housing, employment, and social services.
* Submit all requested data for compliance with program guidelines and documentation requirements.
* Foster a culturally and language competent team that offers a welcoming and supportive client experience for asylum seekers and migrants from diverse backgrounds and circumstances.
* Provide trauma informed care and referrals that meet any emergency needs
* Perform additional duties as assigned by Supervisors to support the overall success of the program.
* Full-time work hours are available Monday-Saturday, flex and weekend hours are available.

**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in social work, human services, public health, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* 1 to 3 years of experience in casework, service navigation, human services, or a related field.
* Fluency in Spanish, French, or one or more other West African languages required.
* Prior experience working with immigrant or asylum-seeker populations strongly preferred.
* Experience in disaster response, emergency services, or public health is an advantage.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to engage with clients and team members professionally and empathetically.
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, high-stress environment.
* Proficient in Data Entry as well as the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and databases.
* Knowledge of the New York City social service landscape and community resources is a plus.
* Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion values, fostering an environment of respect for all.

**Salary range, $47,500 to $52,500 commensurate with experience – with excellent benefits.**  

**No Phone Calls: Send Cover Letter, Resume & 3 Professional References to** **jobs@nydis.org.**

*All qualified candidates should apply; candidates from ethnic and religious minorities are strongly encouraged to apply. NYDIS does not discriminate against any individual or group for reasons of age, color, creed, culture, gender, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, or race.*

title: Migrant Resource Navigator Team Supervisor(s)
description:
### **Migrant Resource Navigator Team Supervisor(s)**


**About NYDIS:**  

New York Disaster Interfaith Services (NYDIS) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit faith-based federation, uniting faith communities, human services providers, and charitable organizations to deliver disaster readiness, response, and recovery services in New York City and Puerto Rico – and, when requested and capable, metro NYC counties.


**Position Overview:**  

NYDIS is seeking a full-time Resource Navigator Supervisor to oversee a team of Resource Navigators serving asylum-seekers and eligible populations at municipal Reticketing Centers. The Supervisor will play a critical role in ensuring that clients are effectively connected to health, human, and social services. This position will mentor, train and manage a team of Resource Navigators, ensuring service delivery standards are met, issues are escalated appropriately, and all compliance and reporting requirements are fulfilled. This is a 12-24 month contract position with the possibility of extension, expected to serve approximately 1,400 clients per week. The Supervisor will report to the Resource Navigation Manager.


**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Manage an onsite Resource Navigator Teams staffing that module at NYC’s Reticketing Center.
* Train and supervise, the day-to-day operations of Resource Navigator Team shifts, ensuring staffing levels are maintained and that teams are effectively meeting the needs of eligible individuals
* Act as the onsite Point of Contact for NYC’s Reticketing Center management. Ensure control and processes follow any escalation for complex client cases or challenges that arise in the Reticketing Centers.
* Train new Resource Navigators in cultural and religious literacy and competency, program protocols, community resources, data entry procedures and resource referral tracking systems.
* Ensure accurate and timely data entry and resource referrals.
* Regularly review data input to ensure compliance with organizational standards and contractual obligations.
* Collaborate with the Resource Navigation Manager to compile reports on service delivery, client trends, and emerging issues. Ensure that all staff comply with reporting requirements and documentation guidelines.
* Provide leadership and coordination in disaster or crisis situations, ensuring the safe, rapid and efficient response of the Resource Navigator team to those settings.
* Foster a culturally and language competent team that offers a welcoming and supportive client experience for asylum seekers and migrants from diverse backgrounds and circumstances.
* Provide trauma informed care and referrals that meet any emergency needs
* Full-time work hours are available Monday-Saturday, flex and weekend hours are available.

**Qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree in social work, human services, public health, or a related field preferred.
* 1-3 years of experience in supervising casework, human services, or disaster staff teams is required.
* Fluency in Spanish, French, or one or more other West African languages required.
* Previous experience working with immigrant or asylum-seeking populations is strongly preferred.
* Experience in disaster, emergency, or public health services is a plus.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage staff teams effectively.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to engage with clients and team members professionally and empathetically.
* Proficient in Data Entry as well as the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and databases.
* Knowledge of the New York City social service landscape and community resources is a plus.
* Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion values, fostering an environment of respect for all.

**Salary range, $55,000 to $60,000 commensurate with experience – with excellent benefits.**  

**No Phone Calls: Send Cover Letter, Resume & 3 Professional References to** **jobs@nydis.org**

*All qualified candidates should apply; candidates from ethnic and religious minorities are strongly encouraged to apply. NYDIS does not discriminate against any individual or group for reasons of age, color, creed, culture, gender, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, or race.*

title: Foreman/Manager
description:
iAG Energy is a growing Energy Efficiency firm helping companies implement strategies to reduce energy usage and save on utility costs.

With a new energy emission law being assigned to buildings throughout the five boroughs, our team has been working tirelessly with building owners to find solutions on how they can become compliant. iAG Energy is ready to expand from compliance and is looking to bring a team on to handle some of the onsite work these buildings need.

Our company is looking to hire a foreman with preexisting supervisory experience, to lead a team through jobsite installations. This would be an excellent opportunity for someone who has strong communication skills, is organized, and deadline driven, eager to continue in a supervisory role.

Job Responsibilities will Include:

* Managing the jobsite team of employees
* Assisting the hired team with the physical labor of installation
* Tracking and organizing supplies needed for each job
* Overseeing work being done at each jobsite
* Communicating with iAG Project Managers
* Tracking the completion of each job
* Daily travel throughout the 5 boroughs

Previous Experience Required:

* 3-4 years of management experience
* Strong communication and leadership skills
* Ability to stay organized and multitask
* Comfortable speaking on the phone and communicating through email

We are urgently hiring for this position as we have jobsites requiring a team starting within the next few weeks. If you feel you would be a great addition to our team, please apply!

Please note physical labor will be required in this role - this is not strictly a supervisory position.

title: Community Outreach Specialist
description:
**Outreach Specialist** 

**Schedule:** 40 Hours Per Week **- STATEN ISLAND, NY** 

**Job Type:** Full Time

**FLSA Status:** Exempt/ Salaried

**Department:** Fatherhood

**Reports To:** Senior Case Manager and Director of Community Initiatives

**Pay Range: $58,500** *(\\*based on city, state and/ or federal contractual obligations and budgetary allowances)*

**POSITION SUMMARY: STATEN ISLAND, NY -** The Outreach Specialist is responsible for community outreach and engagement with youth and adults within the local community, programs, and agencies to educate, enroll and register participants for the coordinating UAU community center programming. The Outreach Specialist is an adaptive and dynamic individual that can connect with community members, deliver compelling presentations to community groups, and develop a network of youth, adults, and service providers. In addition the Outreach Specialist will effectively and successfully excute the marketing and social media needs of UAU as a whole. EOE

**PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES (include but are not limited to):**

· Develop and implement outreach plan to recruit and retain adult participants by forming a familiarity with the local neighborhood, schools and organizations through a variety of platforms.

· Assist with the development and growth of relationships with local, community groups, programs, and agencies.

· Effectively performs outreach and recruitment of non-custodial father to engage and enroll them as participants with UAU.

· Register and enroll a minimum of 5 adult participants.

· Outreach and engage adults in outdoor public spaces.

· Record and manage outreach efforts and attendance for activities, in a effective, constructive and organized manner.

· Maintain accurate outreach notes and other records in accordance with UAU and DYCD protocols and policies and procedures.

· Develop relationships and actively engage with single fathers acclimating back into the community

· Act as a credible messenger with strong community connections.

· Communicate with and serve non-English speaking participants

· Provide adult resources in the areas of recreation, health, civic engagement, leadership, and other enrichment activities as needed

· Abide by all safety protocols as outlined by Department of Health/OCFS, DYCD and UAU.

· Provide support and advocacy to participants.

· Public speaking to audiences of varying sizes and offer and create program presentations

· Assists team members in the delivery of daily services, including providing positive modeling, peer counseling, support and encouragement to participants

· Performs other related duties as necessary or assigned

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS****:**

· 18+ years old, required

· High School diploma or GED (Highschool Equivalency Diploma), required

· Valid Driver’s license required

· 1+ year experience working with adults

· 1 year minimum of community outreach

· Bilingual – English/ Spanish preferred

· Must have a commitment to work from a strength-based perspective

· Must be culturally competent - ability to understand, be sensitive to the needs of, communicate with and effectively interact with people across cultures and age ranges

· Must pass reference checks and background as designated by DOH, DOE, DYCD and UAU

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Strong knowledge of excel, word, power point, social media platforms, email

· Excellent organizational and time management skills

· Demonstrated ability to conduct and complete work independently

· Willing to take initiative and be flexible when needed & work flexible hours as needed

· Excels working in a collaborative environment to achieve target objects and outcomes

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENT****:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job the employee is occasionally required to stand; sit or walk. Specific vision and hearing abilities are required by this job as outlined below.

· Incumbent will be scheduled based on operational need.

· Standard office equipment including computers, fax machines, copiers, printers, telephones, etc.

· Position is in a well-lighted office environment.

· Involves sitting approximately 10% of the day, walking or standing the remainder. Daily travel to site locations. Reimbursed provided, as per UAU policy.

· Must be able to remain in a stationary position for at least 50% of the time.

· May include working prolonged periods of time sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

· The ability to communicate information and ideas so others will understand. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.

· The ability to observe details at close range (within a few feet or more of the observer).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $58,500.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**Looking for a job that's more than just a job? You're in luck!** 

**Corporate Coffee Systems is hiring, and we want YOU to be part of our Top-Notch Customer Service Team!**

Corporate Coffee Systems is a leading New York metropolitan coffee and refreshment supplier which provides a world-class product line and the latest technology to bring that coffee-house feeling to its clients in the tri-state area. We specialize in a full line of name brand refreshment products and business supplies that you can trust.

**Here’s what you’ll be doing:** Reporting to the Client Care Manager at our Westbury, NY location, the ideal Client Care Associate will bring their customer service skills and experience to (but not limited to):

· Answer incoming client calls, take and process orders, and support ACD/Chatlines for prompt intake of orders, inquiries, complaints and client requests

· Assist clients and related departments with order tracking and shipping information, supporting all departments/teams with the order fulfillment cycle, including all order/service-related communications

· Generate order forms in collaboration with Sales Dept. for accounts use of new order submittal

· Arrange service calls and problem-solve client issues

· Research/confirm missed shipments, refusals, mis-picks and returns, along with maintenance of client contact information integrity within the order database.

· Maintain open lines of pre-emptive communications pertaining to credit issuance/validation, backorders, missed stops, today’s install, service calls on hold and accounts in collections status.

· Maintain organized COI department files, updated special handling territory portfolios and auto weekly, biweekly and monthly water tracking account calendars.

· Monitor top 30 account order history for daily outreaches in securing orders.

Our Client Care Department is a valued partner, playing a pivotal role in delivering excellent customer service, significantly impacting our customer relationships and satisfaction. **If you are a customer service Star, come shine at Corporate Coffee Systems!**

**What Else?**

· You’ll need a minimum of 1 Year Call Center Customer Service experience (in a refreshment and/or office supply is a plus).

· Excellent oral and written communication skills, with ability to follow instructions.

· Exhibit excellent professionalism and telephone etiquette with clients, managers and team members

· Ability to resolve low-priority issues without supervision.

· Eagerness to continually increase your knowledge and understanding of Corporate Coffee Systems products, their functionality and use.

· Working knowledge of MS Office applications, including Excel and Outlook.

· High-energy, flexible, self-starter, hands-on, and comfortable working individually and in a team environment.

· **We offer a great opportunity and potential for additional commission-based compensation.** 

· Hours are Monday – Friday, 8:30am – 5:00pm. If you can start in August, you’ll be in time to enjoy our Summertime schedule/hours, allowing an early close on Fridays!

At Corporate Coffee Systems, we believe in inclusivity. Everyone is welcome here, no matter who you are or where you're from! title: Latin Tutor
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated Latin Tutor to join our team in NYC. The tutor will be able to tutor children at their home or school (primarily in the Upper East Side or Brooklyn)

**Apply Here**  
***Interested candidates can apply here.***

https://www.modulo.app/teach

Modulo is a pioneering education company dedicated to providing individualized, flexible, and accessible education solutions for homeschoolers and families seeking alternative learning options. We connect students with expert tutors who tailor their teaching to each child’s unique needs, fostering a love of learning and academic success. Learn more at Modulo.

**Job Overview:**  
We are seeking an enthusiastic and knowledgeable Latin Tutor to join our team in New York City. As a Modulo Latin Tutor, you will work one-on-one with students to help them develop a strong foundation in Latin language, grammar, and culture. You will create personalized lesson plans, engage students in interactive learning experiences, and inspire a passion for the classics. This role is perfect for educators who thrive on customizing their approach to meet the needs of each student, making learning Latin both effective and enjoyable.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide one-on-one in-person Latin tutoring sessions in NYC, focusing on grammar, vocabulary, translation, and cultural context.
* Develop and implement personalized lesson plans tailored to each student’s learning style, goals, and academic needs.
* Foster a positive and engaging learning environment that motivates students to explore and enjoy the study of Latin.
* Monitor and assess student progress, providing feedback and adjusting teaching strategies as needed.
* Collaborate with parents and Modulo’s education team to ensure alignment with each student’s educational goals.

* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts clearly and engagingly.
* Reliable, punctual, and committed to fostering a positive learning environment.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working with homeschooled students or familiarity with alternative education models.
* Ability to integrate cultural and historical context into lessons to enrich the learning experience.
* Familiarity with online tools and platforms to supplement in-person tutoring if needed.

**Benefits of Working with Modulo:**

* Flexible scheduling to accommodate your availability.
* Opportunity to work with a diverse range of students and make a meaningful impact on their educational journeys.

title: Retail Salesperson
description:
**Company Overview**
====================


Bridgestone Retail Operations (BSRO) is part of Bridgestone Americas and employs over 22,000 teammates in North America. BSRO operates more than 2,200 company-owned stores, including Firestone Complete Auto Care, Tires Plus and Wheel Works locations. With locations across North America and more than $3 billion in tire and auto service sales, Bridgestone Retail Operations is the right place to build a career.

  

Whatever role you fill, when you represent the Bridgestone name, you are a valued teammate, and part of our larger mission to “Serve Society with Superior Quality.” We start by offering each teammate more than just competitive pay. We provide formal training, performance incentives, paid vacation and holidays, competitive healthcare packages for full-time and part-time employees, and a 401k plan to help build towards your future.

  

We believe people can only provide superior service and quality to others when they are allowed to bring their whole self to work and know they are supported. We believe in championing all perspectives, individuals and teams because we understand the importance of seeing the world and our business through many different lenses. We are building a team as diverse as the world we serve. So, show us what you’re made of. Show us the smart stuff, the tough stuff, the bold, beautiful and brave stuff. Because who you are is what we need.

**Job Category**
================


Retail**Position Summary**
====================


The Automotive Retail Salesperson is a dynamic and sales-focused role crucial to our team's success. This position entails providing exceptional customer service both in person and over the phone, with the goal of meeting and exceeding customer needs. You will use your energetic demeanor to sell the visit, persuading potential customers to engage with our automotive services. Through effective communication skills, you will build strong relationships with customers, promote our products and services, and establish clear time commitments between technicians and customers for service appointments. Additionally, the Retail Salesperson conducts transaction procedures with precision and efficiency, ensuring a seamless experience for customers throughout their visit. This role offers an exciting opportunity for individuals with a passion for sales and customer service to thrive in a fast-paced automotive retail environment while contributing to the growth and success of our business.**Responsibilities**
====================

* Operating as a motivated sales individual.
* Building customer satisfaction & loyalty.
* Merchandising, advertising and promotion of products and services.
* Energetic responsiveness to every customer, on the phone and in the store.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications**
==========================

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* Desire to succeed in a retail environment.
* 2 years of consumer retail sales experience.
* Must be able to communicate with and assist customers in the areas of sales and complaints to ensure customer retention and loyalty.
* Problem solving skills as it relates to customer complaints
* Must have a valid automobile driver's license at all times and be able to drive customer and company vehicles.

**OUR CREW KNOWS** **BENEFITS**
-------------------------------

* Medical, Dental and Vision – Starting day 1 for all our teammates
* Paid vacation and holidays
* On-the-job training and company-funded ASE certifications
* Tuition reimbursement program
* Flexible work schedule
* 401(k) match
* On demand pay (daily pay) program available

**OUR VALUES GIVE BACK TO** **YOU**
-----------------------------------

* Professional Development: No matter where you’re at in your career, we’ve got the resources to help you level up.
* Community Involvement: We pride ourselves on working with our local communities and giving back where we can.
* Integrity & Teamwork: Part of what makes our teams different is our drive to do things right, always, together.

*Bridgestone is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. It is our policy to consider for employment all individuals regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

**Employment Eligibility**


If hired, a Form I-9 Employment Eligibility Verification must be completed at the start of employment. Temporary work authorization or the need for sponsorship may disqualify you from employment.

title: Registered Nurse (RN) - 1099 Contractor - PRN Side Job
description:
**1099 Independent Contract Registered Nurse - PRN Side Job**

LifePlans, LLC – an illumifin company is a leading provider of business process outsourcing for the insurance industry, managing over 1.3 million long-term care policies for the nation's largest insurers. illumifin is a third-party administrator that makes over 60,000 in-home visits each year.

We’d like to invite you to consider our **per diem** opportunity to earn **supplemental income** as an Independent Contract Nurse (ICN) while utilizing your nursing skills to make a real impact on people’s lives! **The assessments are completed face to face in the client’s homes.**

**You will need the following tools to complete the assessments.**

**For electronic assessments you will need**:

* A mobile device and a printer with a scanning feature or a printer and fax machine

**For paper assessments you will need**

* A printer with scanner or printer with fax machine

**For the Underwriting assessments only, you will need:**

* A calibrated manual upper arm blood pressure cuff
* A calibrated portable scale (to obtain client’s weight)
* A Measuring tape (to obtain client’s height)

As a member of our Network, you will visit clients in their home environment and use your nursing skills to complete face-to-face assessments used in determining eligibility or benefits for evaluated clients. You can accept or decline referrals offered to you. These assessments vary in length from 45 minutes to 2 hours and can consist of a health interview, brief cognitive screen, discussing IADLs, and viewing ADL demonstrations. For Underwriting assessments, you will be checking the height, weight and blood pressure of the client.

**No** blood draws required.

**Minimum Qualifications Required:**

* Unencumbered licensure as a Registered Nurse
* A minimum of two years’ experience as a RN working with adult populations
* Assessment skills are a plus

**Registered Nurse Job Responsibilities:**

As a RN with LifePlans, LLC, you will utilize your critical thinking and assessment skills to complete the following:

* Communicate promptly with illumifin regarding file status and appointment times
* Obtain thorough cognitive and health assessment information as required
* Comply with all assessment instructions and accurately complete assessment paperwork
* Return the assessment within 24 hours after the appointment
* Respond promptly to any follow-up and clarification questions regarding each submitted assessment

**Benefits:**

* Flexible schedule
* No quotas
* No territories

***We’d love to have you join our team!***

Job Types: Contract, PRN

Pay: $1.00 per year

Medical Specialty:

* Geriatrics

Physical Setting:

* Long term care

* RN Nursing: 2 years (Preferred)

description:
Frank Darling is an online female-founded fine jewelry brand making custom engagement rings more accessible than ever before. We’ve been featured in Vogue, WSJ, Bloomberg, Glossy, and a number of other publications for our design, sustainability, and modern take on the bridal category.

We have an immediate, opening for a social media content creator. The ideal candidate is highly creative and self-motivated, with excellent communication skills. S/he is a creative problem solver with a can-do attitude.

**Key Duties and Responsibilities:**

* 3+ years social media experience at a brand or agency with a portfolio of work showcasing still, short and long-form video work for social media.
* You know what’s trending on social media before it blows up; and can respond ASAP to trends/memes in a variety of content types.
* You’re proficient in industry-standard video and graphic design software – Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Canva, and CapCut (Adobe Photoshop, DaVinci Resolve, CaptureOne Pro is a plus)
* Experience in the full social content production lifecycle (ideation, storyboarding, design, videography, photography, etc.), professional camera systems, lighting, shooting, retouching, and color grading.
* Visually proficient creative with an understanding of graphic design, composition, and typography and an eye for details and elevated aesthetics.
* Self-initiated creative with exceptional time & project management skills
* Solid interpersonal skills and passion for engaging with our social media communities
* You’re a highly organized person able to work with high-value items responsibly

* 70%: Lead social media content creation primarily for Instagram, TikTok and Pinterest.
* Create content franchises that engage, educate, entertain, and inspire, crafted to resonate with the Frank Darling community.
* Create content strongly informed by the knowledge of trends, cultural moments, and visual aesthetics.
* Inform ideas based on platform-specific trends, updates, and unique features
* 20%: Write short-form copy for social posts and stories
* 10%: Run day-to-day community management and posting

**Role:**
