title: Media Sales, Client Partner
description:
**Media Sales, Client Partner**

**Base Salary: $110,000 - 130,000**

**Plus Uncapped Commissions: Potential OTE $250,000** 

Trooh is a leading American media company, reaching millions of gen z consumers on their daily journey out-of-home. We have transformed the landscape with the integration of data, insights and digital into large scale, sought-after locations. As leaders in audience targeting to 18-24’s, we have built scale and impact through our campus environments in over 1000+ colleges and universities nationwide. Trooh’s extensive addressable media, spread across thousands of high dwell time locations, ensure high impact solutions to engage gen z consumers at the right time.

This is an exciting opportunity for a **Media Sales, Client Partner** to join our team supporting the New York office. In this role you will be responsible for selling hyper-targeted audience solutions in addition to selling large format digital out-of-home to accounts in your territory. If you are passionate about media sales, and looking for new challenges in a creative environment, which will allow you to leverage integrated media expertise then this role is for you!

**Accountabilities and Responsibilities:**

* Generating leads and following up on them diligently through calls, e-mails, and in-person meetings to turn qualified leads into lucrative sales opportunities.
* You will use your cold-calling, networking, prospecting, pitching, client follow -up and closing skills to identify, develop and manage new accounts or brands that will complement our existing client roster and help you reach your personal revenue targets.
* Own revenue budgets and professionally drive consistent business
* Prospect business leads that will benefit from a progressive suite of DOOH products, by utilizing cold calling techniques, updating CRM, and providing value-added leads.
* Actively hunting and following up on client leads, generating sales through innovative thinking and initiative
* Utilize client and agency relationships to take a consultative approach as a strategic business partner
* Lead sales discussions and deliver pitches to potential clients
* Initiate and build long term revenue partnerships with key clients, planners, buyers, and any other relevant decision-makers to generate business opportunities in your territory
* Deliver on and surpass quarterly and annual sales targets by developing, presenting, and converting a client list consisting of media/advertising agencies and multi-national clients/brands

**What you offer:**

* A bachelor’s degree with 5+ years experience in media sales
* A true “hunter” with experience in media sales – Digital Out-of-Home, Digital Media, Broadcast, etc.
* Demonstrated success in building strong client relationships with contacts at top-tier agencies, advertisers, and brands directly
* Superior customer service skills and a track record of closing new business to meet revenue targets within assigned territory
* Entrepreneurial nature, excited to build out new territories for an already successful and growing business
* Strong understanding of the digital advertising landscape
* Flexible, adaptable, and nimble attitude to excel in a fast-changing and growing sales environment
* Persistent, motivated, self-starter driven by incentives and results
* Exceptional organizational skills coupled with excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
* Professional, outgoing, enthusiastic, and a real team player that is ready to champion the company’s brand
* Strong proficiency in MS Office and experience with Boostr or a similar CRM and the ability to drive results through excellent presentation skills and resources

**What a career at Trooh can offer you?** 

* Competitive compensation packages
* This is a base plus commission structure role
* Full benefits including a 401K and tax savings through a FSA
* Generous paid time off as well as a December holiday closure
* 4.5 Day Work Week with Friday Afternoons off
* Milestone Recognition Program
* Employee Referral bonuses
* Paid Internships
* Training opportunities: Online and leadership development training
* Vibrant team-work environment

We appreciate the interest of all candidates, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Trooh Media is an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Campaign Field Organizer
description:
We are seeking a dynamic and driven Team Lead to oversee and inspire our canvassing teams in the field. The Team Lead will play a critical role in managing and motivating canvassers, ensuring smooth operations, and maintaining high performance standards. This role involves overseeing daily canvassing activities and driving team success through effective leadership and organizational skills.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Embody our Values:** Represent Legion’s commitment to professionalism and flawless execution, especially in interaction with clients when they are on-site. Ensure client expectations are met and upheld.
* **Organize and Manage:** Coordinate canvassing turfs, manage supplies, and oversee the logistical aspects of field operations to ensure efficiency.
* **Payroll and Attendance:** Record payroll for canvassers and yourself. Confirm shift attendances the night before/day of.
* **Performance Evaluation:** Evaluate canvassers daily, compile evaluation data for weekly assessments, and provide constructive feedback and counseling.
* **Quality Control:** Conduct in-field quality checks (QC), work with Deputy Field Directors (DFDs) to support investigations and fact-finding efforts.
* **Reporting:** Compile and submit detailed nightly reports on team performance and activities.
* **Team Morale and Cohesion:** Instill a sense of morale, cohesion, and discipline within the team. Address issues promptly to maintain a positive work environment.
* **Attendance and Shift Management:** Bolster team attendance, manage shift confirmations, and address any issues related to shift scheduling.
* **Development and Accountability:** Develop subordinates through training and mentorship. Establish and maintain paper trails for accountability and development purposes.
* **Discipline and Termination:** Handle disciplinary actions and terminations for tardy, fraudulent, or unruly subordinates as necessary.
* **Performance Goals:** Drive the team towards achieving performance goals and maintain high standards of canvassing effectiveness.
* **Canvasser-App Inputs:** Oversee and manage canvasser-app inputs to ensure accurate data collection and reporting.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** Previous experience in a leadership role within political canvassing or a related field preferred.
* **Leadership Skills:** Proven ability to lead and motivate a team in a high-pressure environment.
* **Organizational Skills:** Strong organizational and logistical skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities.
* **Communication:** Excellent communication skills for interacting with clients, canvassers, and team members.
* **Problem-Solving:** Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to address and resolve issues effectively.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Familiarity with canvassing apps and reporting tools.
* **Commitment:** Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as needed.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
**Job Description:**

Our company is seeking to hire a warehouse employee that involves Picking, Packing and sporadic light unloading of shipments. This position carries future potential to upgrade to Warehouse Manager or Supervisor.

Part of the job description includes maintaining warehouse cleanliness, replenishment of products and organization of merchandise within the warehouse. This position provides plenty of future growth and opportunity as we continue to grow, thrive and expand within the distribution and E-commerce market within the pet channel

This position does not require use of any Forklift machinery.

If you want to be apart of one of the top most emerging eCommerce businesses in the Dog and Cat industry and you carry experience or even if you're new to warehousing and are looking to work this us, we'd love to have you join our team! To learn more about our company visit our website at www.petlife.com or www.shop.petlife.com

**Responsibilities**

* Ensure the Receiving Area and Loading Docks are always kept clean and properly maintained.
* Making sure all isles remain clear of loose inventory or cartons.
* Making sure any and all empty cartons are properly cut, folded and stored for future use or recycling.
* Organizing and Preparing Pick Tickets and Shipping Labels
* Picking and Packing of orders if / when necessary
* Properly Receiving Inventory in our system and properly positioning inventory through our scanning software and grouping of inventory.
* Making sure all inventory is immediately replenished when out of stock.
* Ensuring any and all Returns received are either put back in stock or placed in a separate location for disposal.
* Communicate job expectations and coach employees
* Identify areas of improvement and establish innovative or adjust existing work procedures and practices

**Skills**

* Proven work experience as a warehouse supervisor
* Have the ability to speak English (Spanish, while not required would be beneficial)
* Must be great at identifying issues and problem solving.
* Someone who has the ability to properly move inventory within our inventory software system.
* Must have great organizational skills and be able to move quickly
* Ability to input, retrieve and analyze data
* Hands-on commitment to getting the job done whether it be Picking or Packing orders in situations where short staffing is an issue and initially during the initial training phase.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven ability to direct and coordinate operations
* Strong time management skills
* Physically capable of carrying merchandise and unloading and loading of shipments
* People skills, empowering others to get work done and believing in one another. Proper Team Skill-set is the most important foundation for this job.

title: Warehouse Team Leader/Gauge Calibration Lead
description:
**Warehouse Team Leader/Gauge Calibration Lead**

We rely on efficient and effective warehouse operations to maintain a competitive advantage in our business segments. A management team with a customer-first focus ensures we sustain our valued customer and supplier partners and presents us well when new partners visit our operations. The ideal candidate has strong leadership skills and must be exceptionally detail oriented; able to track multiple facets of the assigned warehouse daily. Additionally, this position will be responsible for the backflow gauge calibration process and operation as we increase the volume of calibrations and gauge repairs that are completed at the facility. This position requires meticulous attention to detail, technical expertise, and a commitment to upholding rigorous quality standards.

**Expectations & Responsibilities**

· Supervise/perform daily activities of a warehouse function: including quality assurance and customer service.

· Elevate responsibility when appointed as acting-Manager. Including opening and closing warehouse during published business hours.

· Calibrate, troubleshoot, repair & test backflow gauges from various manufacturers.

· Document time and materials used in the repair of gauges.

· Communicate internally with sales team members regarding timeframes and estimates for repairs, occasionally communicate directly with customers.

· Prioritize work using promise dates and FIFO methodologies

· Sustain customer loyalty through superior service and presenting a clean and organized (housekeeping) workspace that delights our will call customers.

· Meet operational goals and objectives for assigned warehouse function.

· Establish and maintain timely and effective communications with all reporting structures keeping all informed of facility problem areas as well as other relevant operational issues.

· Establish a team-oriented environment with open and consistent administration of BHC policies and practices.

· Maintain training programs for assigned personnel.

· Foster an environment of continuous improvement.

· Actively maintain a safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations

· Inspect equipment, tools, and machinery regularly. Oversee general maintenance of the infrastructure.

· Perform as acting-Manager in the warehouse whenever Distribution Center Manager is away, offsite, or on vacation.

**Requirements**

* High school diploma or GED, engineering or mechanical background preferred
* 5+ years’ experience in a warehouse
* Mechanical aptitude and the ability to troubleshoot and work with small parts
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently
* Ability to adapt to changing timeframes and priorities
* Ability to stand for extended periods of time
* Ability to travel 5 – 10 weeks annually
* Proficient knowledge of automated inventory systems
* Excellent problem-solving skills and leadership qualities
* Ability to remain calm in challenging situations
* Ability to work with all levels of company staff
* Involves physical exertion and requires the ability to lift up to 50lbs
* Proven experience in gauge calibration and repair, preferably in an industrial or manufacturing environment. (Optional)
* Proficiency in using calibration equipment and software, with a strong understanding of calibration principles and techniques. (Optional)

Associates also have the responsibility to report violations of the Policies and Procedures and report any safety concerns to their supervisor/manager.

title: Market Intelligence Associate
company: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of New York
Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems.  

  

The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person. Employees can expect to be in the office a couple of days per week as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance.
What we do:
International cash distribution, market analysis, and customer relationship management is a strategic business line of the Federal Reserve System, managed by the Global Currency Programs & Services (GCPS) department of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. The GCPS department leads the Federal Reserve’s role in the global distribution of over $200 billion U.S. dollar banknotes annually. The Market Intelligence team of the GCPS department monitors developments in the wholesale USD banknote market, produces analytical products on the use and flows of U.S. dollars banknotes overseas, and works with a variety of internal and external stakeholders on policy and operational issues related to the international wholesale U.S. dollar business.  

Your role as Market Intelligence Associate:* Provides real-time monitoring and analysis of developments in the global USD wholesale banknote market to identify risks to market functioning and sanctions compliance.
* Provides subject matter expertise to FRBNY and Federal Reserve System (FRS) workstreams by following international financial and economic developments, as well as geopolitical events, to fill in intelligence gaps and support policy discussions.
* Develops and maintains working relationships with market participants and industry contacts.
* Collaborates with Compliance Function on investigation efforts, gathers and analyzes data, develops structured and ad hoc analytical products for FRS stakeholders and US government agencies.

  

What we are looking for:* Seasoned professional independent contributor with a background in macroeconomic analysis, intelligence, international relations, or equivalent work experience.
* Demonstrated understanding of fundamental macroeconomic principles and international financial market analysis.
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills and the ability to explain complex topics clearly and succinctly is paramount, must have expertise in presenting analysis visually (Tableau).
* Excellent writing abilities, including experience preparing written reports, presentations, briefings, or recommendations for management.
* Foundational ability to construct and maintain databases to automate and improve the analysis and monitoring of data from multiple sources.
* Basic proficiency with at least one statistical programming language (e.g., Stata, R) and familiarity with extracting data using SQL.


Basic comprehension of BSA/AML compliance.
Salary Range: $116500 - $144200 / year*We believe in transparency at the NY Fed. This salary range reflects a variety of skills and experiences candidates may bring to the job. We pay individuals along this range based on their unique backgrounds. Whether* *you’re* *stretching into the job or are a more seasoned candidate, we aim to pay competitively for your contributions*.  

Our Touchstone Behaviors—Communicate Authentically, Collaborate Inclusively, Drive Progress, Develop Others, and Take Ownership—help shape the culture of the Bank. They also provide a shared language for how we work together and achieve success, and they set clear expectations for leading with impact at every stage of your career with us. Learn more.  

Benefits:
Our organization offers benefits that are the best fit for you at every stage of your career:* Fully paid Pension plan and 401k with Generous Match
* Comprehensive Insurance Plans (Medical, Dental and Vision including Flexible Spending Accounts and HSA)
* Subsidized Public Transportation Program
* Tuition Assistance Program
* Onsite Fitness & Wellness Center
* And more

title: FLEXIBLE Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA), LBA Center Position
company: Denise Wright Licensed Behavior Analyst PLLC
description:
Behavior Change Success and Denise Wright Licensed Behavior Analyst PLLC is an agency that provides Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services for individuals with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Our supportive, inclusive culture helps every individual reach their highest potential.

This **weekend** opportunity at Behavior Change Success Corp and Denise Wright Licensed Behavior Analyst PLLC offers BCBA professionals a flexible and supportive work environment with the following key benefits:

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS

* **Free CEUs**: Access to free Continuing Education Workshops to maintain your certification.
* **Scheduling**: Customize your hours to fit around your personal commitments. You can choose small shifts (1-2 students per weekend) or longer shifts (6-8 hour sessions with 6-8 students).
* **Higher Pay Rates**: Compensation is competitive, with additional pay for treatment planning.
* **Paid Treatment Planning**: Earn extra compensation for preparing your sessions—1 hour of paid planning for a 6-hour session and 30 minutes for a 3-hour session.
* **No Report Writing**: Focus on your clients without the additional burden of report writing.
* **Collaborative Environment**: Work alongside a progressive group of colleagues in regular brainstorming sessions, allowing for the development of novel teaching strategies. Fun and unique environment that fosters exploration of novel teaching paradigms.
* **Flexible Service Requirements**: **Monthly supervision** for smaller authorization protocols allows for a higher caseload without overwhelming supervision demands.

This position is ideal for BCBA professionals seeking to balance career growth with personal commitments, offering a chance to work creatively in a supportive setting.

**Responsibilities:**

* Completing Skill Acquisition Assessments
* Conducting Functional Behavior Assessments and Analysis
* Develop Treatment Plans
* Development and Implement Behavior Intervention Plans
* Provision of BCBA, LBA and RBT Supervision
* Provide parent training and support
* Create individualized programs
* Implement data-based decisions
* Some roles require experience working in the school setting
* Team building and program expansion
* Program development, staff training and generation of new ideas

**Qualifications:**

* BCBA or and Licensed Behavior Analyst, Master's in social work, psychology, education or a related field, with behavioral expertise.
* Knowledge of behavior strategies
* Familiarity with Individual Education Plans (IEP)
* Experience in providing behavior consultation and psycho education

Denise Wright Licensed Behavior Analyst PLLC provides a supportive and inclusive culture throughout our agency. We work to provide others with respect and dignity. At Denise Wright Licensed Behavior Analyst PLLC, we work to ensure that others feel respected and embraced by a community. Our values are reflected in our hiring process and throughout the services we offer.

title: Full Time Teller
description:
Summary:

A Bank Teller is responsible for providing exceptional customer service including efficient and accurate transaction processing.  
Role and Responsibilities:  
· Balance currency, coin, and checks in cash drawer at end of shift/as necessary. Calculate transactions using computer, calculator, or adding machine.

· Cross-sell bank products and services based on customer needs in accordance with the banks ‘program standards.

· Cash checks and pay out currency after verifying that signatures are correct, that written and numerical amounts agree, and accounts have sufficient funds.

· Receive checks and cash for deposit, verify amounts, and check accuracy of deposit slips.

· Examine checks for endorsements and to verify other information such as dates, bank names, identifications of the persons receiving payments and the legality of the documents.

· Assist in preparation of currency and coin shipment to the Federal Reserve Bank.

· Identify transaction mistakes when cash drawer is out of balance/debits and credits do not balance.

· Process transactions such as time deposit, retirement savings plan contributions/distributions, night deposits, mail deposits, cashier checks and safe deposit box payments.

· Maintain the bank’s files for currency transaction reports, suspicious activity reports and general correspondence.

· Assesses risk of all financial transactions executed.

· Perform other duties as assigned.  
Qualifications and Education Requirements  
High School diploma or equivalent.

Strong math and logic skills.

Depending on branch location, you may be required to work occasional evening and Saturday hours.  
Preferred Skills  
Working knowledge of COCC, Insight a plus.  
Cash Handling experience in a banking or retail setting.

title: Executive Housekeeper
company: TKP Bar & Grill, Crowne Plaza Newark
description:
Seeking an experienced **Director of Housekeeping**, with strong abilities to lead, motivate, empower a team and assist staff in performing their duties to the best of their abilities. Fostering a positive and collaborative work environment, and coaching staff as needed.

**Roles and Responsibilities:** This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of all job functions that an employee in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.

* Communicate effectively with all employees through daily standup meetings, with supervisors through weekly meetings.
* Work closely with other departments *(Front desk, Engineering, Food & Beverage, Sales, etc...)*
* Report to engineering/maintenance any and all problems needing repairs.
* Develop and implement new programs as needed.
* Focus on Guest Satisfaction Reviews.
* Ensure that all guest rooms/housekeeping areas are cleaned up to standard. To exceed guests’ expectations through the excellence program.
* Support the direct supervisors in the department through open door policy.
* Create a courteous friendly, professional, work environment through open line of communication.
* Prepare shift schedule according to Hotel Occupancy and special functions.
* Ensure compliance with safety and sanitation standards.
* See that inspection program is consistently maintained through daily inspections.
* Ensure that all public areas are clean to standard through daily inspection.
* Maintain a regular deep cleaning program, a monthly planner consisting of a project a day. Floor/carpet care. Flipping of mattresses (Keeping records/check lists).
* Maintain a monthly linen inventory (must be completed on 30th to the 1st of every month). Supply inventory should be done once a week (order as needed).
* Ensure rooms are inspected daily.
* Maintain an overall clean and safe hotel for our guests as well as our employees, establishing and maintaining quality control and utilizing the proper equipment and supplies for the efficient and economical operation of the hotel.
* Interview prospective employees.
* Keep daily attendance records.
* Other duties as assigned by Management.

**PREREQUISITES:**

**Education:** 

* High school education or equivalent. Degree in hospitality management.
* Must be able to speak, read, write and understand the English which is the primary language used in this workplace.

**Experience:** 

* **A minimum of three (3) years previous housekeeping management experience**, as either an *Assistant Housekeeping Manager* or *Executive Housekeeper*.
* Knowledge and/or experience working in a union environment.

**Requirements:** Due to the cyclical nature of the hospitality industry, employees may be required to work varying schedules (including Holidays and weekends) to reflect the business needs of the hotel. In addition, attendance at all scheduled training sessions and meetings is required.

* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Great communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work diverse shifts, weekends, and holidays, infusing a sense of excitement and variety into your routine.
* **Physical:** Requires bending, stooping, climbing, standing, walking, sitting, reaching, grasping, carrying, repetitive motions, visual acuity, hearing, writing and good verbal skills.
* **Bilingual is a plus (French/Creole/Spanish)**.

**NOTICE:** 

**Friendwell Managed Hotels function twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week, 365 days a year. As a part of the hospitality industry a hospitable service atmosphere must be maintained at all times. All employees are required to project a friendly, welcoming, and positive attitude.**

title: Bilingual ESL Teacher for Adults
description:
We are looking for enthusiastic teachers to motivate and prepare our students to achieve their goals by developing effective English communication skills. Lift and inspire others by planning and delivering high-quality, creative, and engaging lessons for diverse groups learning English as a Second Language (ESL). Training provided.

About UCEDA Institute:

UCEDA Institute began in 1988 with a simple idea to empower students through mastery of the English language. Today we've evolved into a chain of schools with many locations and branches in popular areas throughout the United States. For millions of individuals throughout the world, English continues to serve as a bridge to greater possibilities and success. We are proud to continue guiding ambitious students towards their goals, and we invite you to join us.

UCEDA Institute has an immediate Part-Time opportunity for an Adult ESL Instructor in Tinton Falls, NJ.

**Tentative schedule: Tuesday and Thursday 2:30pm-4:30pm**

-Prepare lesson plans and deliver quality classroom instruction by following the standard UCEDA class format and using UCEDA materials.

- Apply a developmental approach to learning, coaching students according to their individual development needs, and encouraging self-expression leading to a successful student experience.

- Play an active role in helping students persist toward their goals by closely monitoring students' attendance and performance, addressing issues appropriately, and following proper procedures in tutoring, homework, etc.

- Report students' academic progress periodically to ensure they are mastering the skills on a regular basis.

- Use a variety of activities and instructional methods (songs, stories, media, structured games etc.) to motivate and stimulate students.

- Cooperate with the School Manager and other administrative staff.

- Attend training sessions and seminars provided by UCEDA leadership.

- Set a positive example of compliance with school policies.

Required Qualifications:

- Bilingual speaker preferred (English/Spanish).

- Experience applying a structured approach to teaching, training, coaching, and/or motivating others to achieve their goals.

- High level of common-sense: Able to connect with others, identify and respond to behavioral trends, adapt quickly to circumstances, and interpret non-verbal communication cues.

- Strong interpersonal skills and experience dealing with people of many cultures, showing an appropriate level of respect and cultural sensitivity.

- Motivated, creative, organized, patient, flexible, enthusiastic about others' success.

- Strong understanding of grammar, excellent written and verbal communication skills required.

- CELTA, TEFL, TESL, or other formal training in ESL teaching strongly preferred.

Don't miss this opportunity to start or continue your career in the Education industry. UCEDA thrives on promoting within and offers constant training and professional development with growing responsibilities. Not only will you be growing professionally and as an individual, you will also be providing many students with an opportunity to improve their lives tremendously through the education they receive.

title: High School Science Teacher
description:
**About Us:**

Prospect Schools is a high performing, intentionally diverse, K-12 college preparatory charter network with seven schools in Brooklyn. We have set a vision to become, by 2025, **the leading network of intentionally diverse schools where students and educators can work, learn, and thrive.** We hope you’ll join us on this journey.

Our experienced team of leaders and educators works hard every day to prepare a diverse student body to have a positive impact on society and develop a lifelong passion for learning. We are committed to offering a rigorous educational experience to all of our students regardless of background, familial income, or geography, because we believe all children have the right to a high quality education. The strong relationships across our communities allows us to push our mission forward each day for more than 2,100 students.

Our Core Values are:

* **Curiosity:** Develop sound judgment and intellect by asking questions confidently and thinking critically
* **Care:** Support others by grounding every action in empathy while championing equity and inclusion in our work
* **Persistence:** Grow and learn by solving problems with determination, creativity and tenacity
* **Passion:** Succeed by approaching challenges with excitement, enthusiasm and self assurance


**About the Role:**

Prospect Schools is seeking an organized, flexible, and mission-driven **High School Science** **Teacher** to join us in support of our growing network of schools. The ideal candidate is fully dedicated to the mission of Prospect Schools and to supporting the success of our students and families. As part of an ambitious and high-performing instructional team, our teachers are expected to create positive, equitable classroom environments that excite and invest our students in their learning goals. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

***Planning and Instruction***

* Design and implement culturally responsive lesson plans that engage students and foster a love for learning
* Teach **4 Sections of Science curriculum, with one Advisory period,** to an intentionally diverse classroom and actively work to engage all students throughout the lesson
* Attend regular coaching meetings with your direct manager and professional development sessions as part of the school team
* Use data-informed methods to modify and differentiate instruction to meet the needs of the individual learners
* Demonstrate deep knowledge of content and effective pedagogy, evidenced by clear and objective-driven instruction and meaningful student engagement practices
* Where applicable, serve as an Advisor to students, motivating students across academic skill levels and cultivating students’ social-emotional awareness and well-being
* Demonstrate successful partnership with classroom or subject area co-teacher and utilize multiple co-teaching models in the classroom


***Classroom Environment***

* Consistently model our core values and provide opportunities for students to learn about and practice them
* Set the tone of the classroom as a positive place that fosters both high expectations and student voice and expression
* Set clear expectations and institute routines in order to create a purposeful, supportive, and warm environment for learning
* Build a classroom community that uses culturally sustaining practices to ensure that students feel safe, valued, and respected by adults and their peers


***Parent Partnership***

* Build relationships and provide ongoing progress updates through regular communication with the families of all students in your classroom
* Utilize family and student feedback to continuously improve the learning experience for your students
* Coordinate and facilitate meetings with families on both an ad hoc basis and during regularly scheduled events, such as Report Card Night


***Adult Culture and Teamwork***

* Demonstrate a willingness to be flexible in your role and adapt to school and student needs
* Embody a Team First mindset by proactively seeking opportunities to build relationships and collaborate across functional teams, actively participate in professional development opportunities, and engage families and community members
* Demonstrate a commitment to giving and receiving feedback for the purpose of continuous growth and learning
* Engage in learning opportunities designed to promote stronger Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion practices at Prospect Schools


**Candidate Requirements:**

* Bachelors Degree
* Prior teaching experience preferred
* Exceptionally strong organizational skills, with a keen attention to detail
* Experience working in a diverse school community
* Adept at collaborating and building community with others
*The critical features of this job are described above; they may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.*

**Benefits:**

* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Paid Time Off (PTO) or Paid Sick Time (PST) based on date of hire and hours worked per week
* 10-month contract including ~5-6 weeks of prescribed summer vacation (depending on the calendar), as well as regular school breaks and holidays during the school year
* 401(K) and Roth IRA with a 4% employer match with a 3-year vesting schedule
* Flexible spending accounts, including Transit Commuter Options, Health Care FSA and Dependent Care FSA options
* Ancillary insurance, including Basic Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, and Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program with free expert support services to assist with a variety of life issues, from family care to mental health services


**Salary:**

Employees at Prospect Schools are provided with a competitive salary. Our salaries are set through a lens of equity, and based on an individual’s skills, education, and years of experience relevant to the role. As a teacher, your salary is determined by both years of teaching experience and postsecondary education. The salary range for this role is from **$61,500-$102,880.**

**If you are a current employee, please submit a** **Talent Ticket** **confirming you have applied for this role.**

title: G.S. Wilcox & Co. - Executive Administrative and Marketing Assistant
description:
**G.S. Wilcox & Co. – Executive Administrative and Marketing Assistant**

**Description**

G.S. Wilcox & Co. is a leader in the commercial real estate mortgage banking industry, providing debt and equity solutions to developers, real estate private equity firms, institutional investors, and other owners of commercial real estate. The firm, which has been in business for over 30 years, currently has 20 correspondent life insurance company relationships for which it services $1.6 billion of loans for. The Company is seeking a highly qualified individual for the position of Executive Administrative and Marketing Assistant.

**Required Functions and Responsibilities**

Personal support for firm’s Partners

* Keep and maintain calendar
* Schedule business and personal engagements
* Arrange transportation
* Perform personal tasks and errands as needed
* Take messages and maintain phone log for all calls
* Monitor LinkedIn page

Administrative

* Answer and direct all incoming calls
* Greet visitors
* Order all office supplies and maintain inventory
* Maintain database of all client contact information
* Ship all packages and track delivery
* Make travel arrangements for the team
* Prepare meeting minutes
* Register team for industry conferences and seminars
* Sort and distribute mail
* Maintain common reception area and supply room
* Monitor compliance issues on an ongoing basis and make recommendations for implementation
* Prepare and maintain the industry events calendar
* Maintain and test disaster recovery, cyber security, and document protection plans

Marketing

* Monitor and update company website and LinkedIn page on a daily basis
* Utilize Publisher and Canva to produce company advertisements and event invitations
* Produce and compile press releases, newsletters, and company announcements
* Create email blasts of newsletters and other marketing correspondence
* Organize internal and external events for company
* Manage and promote WBENC platform
* Produce presentations for client meetings

Servicing & Financials

* Monitor Professional Employer Organization (PEO) and assist with Human Resource activities including vacation and sick time tracking and verification
* Perform periodic audits of UCC’s, Insurance and Taxes for servicing
* Maintain and update credit card folder and reconcile statements to the invoices
* Review or enter rent roll information into servicing system
* Manage fund raising efforts
* Deposit payment checks for loan and rental payments
* Assist with other loan servicing tasks

**Skills and Qualifications**

* Proven experience as an executive assistant and/or as a marketing assistant.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of handling sensitive and confidential information.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
* Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks effectively, and manage heavy workloads in a deadline-driven, fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
* Proficiency with Social Media (including but not limited to LinkedIn).
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* High level of discretion, professional demeanor, integrity, and ethics.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders.
* Ability to run errands as needed.

**Education and Experience**

* Associate or bachelor’s degree preferred.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in an executive assistant and/or marketing role preferred.
* Experience in supporting senior executives or high-level management.
* Experience in managing both business and personal tasks for executives is a plus.
* Demonstrated experience working in an office environment.

**Please provide Cover Letter and Professional Resume to wwilcox@gswilcox.com for consideration.**

title: Seasonal Pack and Ship Associate
description:
Baseball Lifestyle 101 is a growing apparel company located in Farmingdale, New York. We pride ourselves on the community that we have built and the clothing that represents baseball fanatics everywhere. We believe the team we build today is the foundation for our future success.

The Pack and Ship Associate is responsible for fulfilling orders by arranging inventory in shipping containers and preparing them for shipment. Duties include interpreting order invoices to determine which items need to be sent out, performing quality control assessments and stacking items safely and securely in the right packaging. The Pack and Ship Associate will report directly to the Pack and Ship Manager.

\\*This position is a Seasonal Pack and Ship Associate with the possibility of a permanent position\\*

The Pack and Ship Associate is responsible for the following:

* Inspecting packages to ensure they are not damaged
* Inspecting shipping containers to ensure they meet shipping regulations
* Assembling daily orders by shipping location or any other shipping categories
* Keeping records of packages including delivery notes, invoices, etc.
* Filling out packing and order forms with the relevant shipping information
* Sealing shipping containers and labeling them appropriately
* Cleaning shipping containers and other shipping supplies
* Maintains a clean and organized work space.
* Contributes to a positive work environment.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Required Experience:** 

* Previous experience in a warehouse or distribution center, preferred
* Familiarity with materials handling equipment such as reach trucks and pallet jacks
* Basic mechanical knowledge for troubleshooting equipment issues
* Strong attention to detail for quality control purposes
* Ability to perform heavy lifting and physical tasks as required

**Physical Requirements:** 

* Standing or sitting for extended periods
* Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
* Repetitive wrist motion
* Audible recognition of alarms

title: Custodian/Janitor
description:
AUSCO, Inc is an engineering driven manufacturer of miniature fluid control components and systems for high value, performance critical applications. AUSCO offers a spectrum of solutions from cost effective Standard Products, Build to Specification Products, and Manifold Solutions for all fluid systems, including:

***Hydraulics***  *Fuels* ***Lube Oil***  *Coolants* ***Water***  *Pneumatics*

\\*\\*We are currently seeking an Part Time, **experienced** Custodian for our Corporate Office and Manufacturing Plant\\*\\*

**SUMMARY/SCOPE OF POSITION:**

Under general supervision, the Custodian is responsible to perform a wide variety of custodial and maintenance duties to maintain and sustain a clean, efficient and safe workplace environment.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

***Daily:***

* Clean and dust furniture, tables, blinds, pictures, mirrors, and other company owned equipment throughout office and shop
* Sanitize multi-touch areas (doorknobs/appliances/break areas)
* Thoroughly clean all restrooms, refill paper and soap dispensers.
* Empty waste baskets and remove trash from premises.
* Maintain inventory of building maintenance, janitorial and sanitary supplies.
* Follow instructions regarding the use of chemicals and supplies.
* Demonstrate good working relationships with other employees.
* Ensure thorough familiarity and compliance with company policies.
* Follow safety guidelines.
* Other duties as assigned or required.

***Bi-Weekly:***

* Sweep, mop, and vacuum floors.
* Clean all interior glass

***As Needed:***

* Wash exterior windows.
* Replace interior and exterior light bulbs.
* Remove debris from building grounds.
* Snow removal from sidewalks, driveways, and parking areas / Salt
* Move furniture, tables, machines and equipment
* Assist with the setup of meetings, conferences, and events.
* Handle scrap and recyclable materials.
* Additional work hours in excess of normal business hours may be necessary to perform essential job functions.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* High School diploma
* Minimum 4 years of professional office custodial experience
* Manufacturing custodial experience is a plus
* English language proficiency.
* Must have good communication skills both verbal and written.

**ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

* Routinely performs duties in a production environment.
* Exposure to production level noise.
* Required to stand for long periods of time.
* Near visual acuity to read and hearing ability to monitor equipment sounds.
* Must be able to lift a minimum of 25 lbs without accommodations

**ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY:**

It is the responsibility of every employee to actively adhere to all Environmental and Safety Policies and to perform their duties in accordance with those policies. Employees must conduct tasks in accordance with applicable health, safety, quality and environmental regulations (state/federal laws, ISO 9001, AS 9100, etc.).

*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to the job. They are not intended to be an all-encompassing list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. Reasonable accommodations to essential functions of the job will be made if necessary.*

*It is the policy of AUSCO, Inc. to provide equal employment opportunity regardless of race, ethnicity, religion/creed, sex, gender identity, gender expression, citizenship, religion, color, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, domestic violence victim status, employee’s or dependent’s reproductive decision making, marital status, pregnancy, arrest or conviction record, credit history, veteran status, salary history, unemployment status, caregiver status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.* 

*This policy applies to all employment practices and personnel actions. We expect all associates to help to maintain a climate that provides equal opportunity to all.*

title: Upper School Study Hall Monitor
description:
Berkeley Carroll is a Pre-K through grade 12 college preparatory school of close to 1000 students located in the Park Slope section of New York City. Our vibrant intellectual community draws students from all over the city, admission to the school is competitive, and both our parents and students value achievement and community.

**Berkeley Carroll’s Upper School seeks a full-time (8:30AM-3:30PM, Monday-Thursday; 8:30-2:45, Friday) Study Hall and student space monitor starting Oct. 1, 2024.** 

We are seeking an employee to staff the Upper School Study Hall (or similar student space) each day. While this employee will need to remain in the same space for all or most of the school day, there is also some opportunity for individual work (reading, writing, etc) each period. This primarily student-facing role involves the following responsibilities:

* Taking attendance each period.
* Ensuring students are following the rules and norms of the space (regarding technology use, silent study, etc).
* Coordinating make-up testing by distributing and managing exams and ensuring compliance with exam expectations.
* Maintaining an environment that ensures academic integrity
* Communicating proactively with students, faculty, and the Upper School Office, both in person and via email.

Requirements:

* Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree
* An interest in being part of a school community
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Comfort setting and maintaining boundaries with high school students.

Berkeley Carroll is committed to creating an environment that includes a diversity of perspectives and to cultivating an equitable, inclusive learning community in which everyone has the opportunity to experience a sense of belonging. Candidates with a demonstrated commitment to and experience with diversity, equity or inclusion work are especially encouraged to apply.

The salary range for this position is $30.00 - $35.00 an hour.

Candidates should send a cover letter, resume, and completed **Berkeley Carroll Employment Application** to:

Tell Blackstock, Upper School Office Manager: sblackstock@berkeleycarroll.org

Sarah Sterling, Upper School Administrative Assistant: ssterling@berkeleycarroll.org

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $35.00 per hour

title: School Nurse
description:
Responsibilities:  
Working collaboratively with health care providers, students parents, school district staff and community agencies to ensure access and continuity of care for students  
Assisting in the establishment and maintenance of a comprehensive school health program  
Collecting information about the health development status of students for compliance with state immunization regulations and Board of Education policies  
Conducting school programs of immunization, physical examinations, and sight and hearing testing  
Performing nursing assessment for students who are ill or injured  
Applying appropriate theory as basis for providing first aid, nursing care, intervention and referrals for those students  
Implementing Board policy with respect to the exclusion and readmission of students in connection with certain infectious and contagious diseases  
Maintaining accurate records and documentation in accordance with state and federal law, and Board of Education policies  
Developing individual health care plan (ICHP) when needed with specific goals, nursing diagnosis, and interventions delineating school-nursing actions unique to students’ needs and for incorporation into the student’s individualized educational plan (IEP)  
Intervening as guided by the nursing care plan to implement nursing actions that promote, maintain or restore health, prevent illness and effect rehabilitation  
Serving as a member of school teams as designated health care professional  
Providing guidance, counseling and health education to students, parents and employees as necessary  
Reporting to parents, school district personnel, physicians, clinics, and others as needed to meet student health needs  
Providing health education to students as requested  
Notifying the appropriate person or agency of student’s injury/illness in accordance with Board policy as necessary  
Conferring with parents, students and school district staff and professionals to interpret health and developmental assessments

Qualifications:  
Bachelor’s degree  
Must meet qualifications of a school nurse as defined in state regulations  
Successful experiences working with pediatric population, preferably in a community or school setting  
Registered professional nurse, designated as RN as defined and determined by state law, and currently licensed in the state  
Current certification in Cardio-Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)

title: SQL and MySQL Administrator
description:
**SQL and MySQL Administrator**  
**Princeton NJ**  
**Job Type: FTE**

**Job Description:**

The Level 2 MySQL Administrator oversees administration tasks for MySQL database systems. Responsibilities include optimizing performance, ensuring reliability, and providing expert support for both production and development environments. Collaboration with application developers, technical leadership, and adherence to industry standards are key aspects of this role. Strong problem-solving skills and expertise in both Windows Server and MySQL administration are essential.

**SQL / MySQL Database Administration:**

* Deploy,

configure, and manage MySQL database servers in high availability  
environments, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.

* Implement

database schema, indexing strategies, and partitioning to optimize query  
performance and enhance scalability.

* Develop

and maintain database backup and recovery procedures, including regular  
backups, point-in-time recovery, and disaster recovery planning.

* Perform

database performance tuning and optimization, including query  
optimization, resource utilization analysis, and database cache  
management.

* Monitor

database health and performance metrics, identify bottlenecks, and  
implement corrective actions to ensure optimal database performance.

* Implement

and manage database security measures, including user access controls,  
authentication mechanisms, and data encryption.

* Collaborate

with application developers to troubleshoot database-related issues and  
optimize database queries for improved application performance.

* Provide

expert support for Applications databases in the development and test  
environments.

* Work

with Application developers and their logical data models, create physical  
Application database designs which conform to industry standards (e.g.,  
data normalization), optimize performance, and efficiently utilize disk  
space, size tables, and indexes for production implementation based on  
projected row counts provided by Applications.

* Create

complex new databases and Application database objects (e.g., tables,  
indexes, procedures), and as requirements change, update data  
structures/objects in existing databases.

* Coordinate

production database deployment including tasks to promote database objects  
between environments (e.g., test to production) in support of Application  
requirements.

* Provide

technical leadership to Application developers in database capabilities  
and features, build efficient queries, database design, Application  
database Problem Resolution, and the use of database utilities.

* Determine

and implement appropriate Application database backup and recovery  
strategies, including decisions regarding frequency of backup and  
procedures for recovering Application database changes.

* Perform production database recovery when

necessary.

**Qualifications**:

- Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.

- Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in SQL/MySQL database administration.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and strategically.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $105,508.00 per year

Experience:

* Windows: 1 year (Required)
* SQL: 1 year (Required)
* Analysis skills: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Princeton, NJ 08540 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Princeton, NJ 08540: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Middleware Administrator
description:
**Middleware Systems Administrator**

**Location - Princeton, NJ**

**5days Onsite** 

**Summary:**  
We are seeking a highly skilled Middleware Systems Administrator (Level 2) with 3-5 years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in managing and supporting a wide range of middleware technologies, including Apache Tomcat, AppViewX, GitHub, IBM Data Quality Management, IBM DataStage, IBM HTTP Server, IBM MQ, IBM Quality Stage, IBM WebSphere, IIS, Java, Liferay, Loadrunner, PeopleSoft, Springboot, Talend, Terraform, ColdFusion, FHIR, Ab Initio, Angular, Ansible, and Apache/TC Server. This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the stability, performance, and reliability of our middleware infrastructure while working with cutting-edge technologies.  
**Key Responsibilities:**  
1 Configure, deploy, and maintain Apache Tomcat, AppViewX, GitHub, IBM Data Quality Management, IBM DataStage, IBM HTTP Server, IBM MQ, IBM Quality Stage, IBM WebSphere, IIS, Java, Liferay, Loadrunner, PeopleSoft, Springboot, Talend, Terraform, ColdFusion, FHIR, Ab Initio, Angular, Ansible, and Apache/TC Server environments.  
2 Monitor middleware systems for performance, availability, and security, responding to alerts and resolving issues promptly to minimize downtime.  
3 Implement and maintain automation scripts and tools to streamline middleware administration tasks and improve operational efficiency.  
4 Collaborate with development teams to troubleshoot application issues related to middleware configurations, performance, and integration.  
5 Perform routine maintenance tasks, including patching, upgrades, and security hardening, to ensure the stability and security of middleware platforms.  
6 Assist in capacity planning, performance tuning, and optimization of middleware systems to meet business requirements and performance objectives.  
7 Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to resolve middleware-related incidents and problems.  
8 Document standard operating procedures, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting steps for middleware systems and applications.  
9 Ensure compliance with industry best practices, standards, and regulatory requirements for middleware configuration and management.  
10 Stay updated on emerging technologies and trends in middleware administration, recommending and implementing innovative solutions to enhance infrastructure performance and reliability.  
11 Participate in on-call rotation and after-hours support as needed to ensure 24/7 availability and support for critical middleware services.  
12 Provide training and knowledge sharing to junior administrators and support teams on middleware technologies and best practices.  
**Skills:**

* Extensive experience with Apache Tomcat, AppViewX, GitHub, IBM Data Quality Management, IBM DataStage, IBM HTTP Server, IBM MQ, IBM Quality Stage, IBM WebSphere, IIS, Java, Liferay, Loadrunner, PeopleSoft, Springboot, Talend, Terraform, ColdFusion, FHIR, Ab Initio, Angular, Ansible, and Apache/TC Server.
* Strong understanding of middleware architecture, deployment, and configuration management.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Bash, or Python for automation tasks.
* Knowledge of networking concepts, protocols, and security principles related to middleware environments.
* Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to analyze and debug complex middleware issues.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
* Attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving and task management.
* Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes is a plus.

**Certifications:** Relevant certifications such as IBM Certified System Administrator - WebSphere Application Server, Oracle Certified Professional (OCP), or equivalent, are desirable.  
**Education:** Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Additional certifications or training in middleware technologies are preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $100,000.46 per year

Experience:

* Tomcat: 1 year (Required)

Security clearance:

* Confidential (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Princeton, NJ 08540 (Preferred)

title: Training & Content Development Associate
description:
**About Blank Street**
----------------------



At Blank Street, we believe that rituals matter, and that great rituals make your life better. With coffee shops across the US and UK, we are working to transform the grab-and-go coffee transaction into an experience that is higher in quality, hospitality, and joy.


**What's Brewing...**
---------------------



As Blank Street's Training & Content Development Associate, you'll hold primary responsibilities to the development, maintenance and implementation of our Learning Management Software, Blank Street University. You will also be responsible for crafting all field communications and training tools. You will excel at building informative, fun, and engaging learning content that will prepare our field team to be a success in their roles. This is an in-person role based out of our Brooklyn, NY HQ office and will report into the Training and Product Quality Manager.



If you are passionate about building something new from the ground-up and are motivated to continuously learn and grow in your role, Blank Street is for you.


**What You'll Own:**
--------------------


* Create and maintain an engaging training experience that is the source of truth regarding Blank Street standards on our world-class LMS.
* Build training materials, tools, and programs for all product and operational rollouts as well as market specific materials for the US
* Support Field Teams by leading efforts to improve Training Materials and programs to better serve them. (making material visually appealing, accurate, engaging, fun, easier to digest)
* Develop and foster cross functional relationships and build effective communication tools between HQ and the Field to create harmony and connection
* Support the development and implementation of continuing education classes for the field teams
* Support the field by helping to develop and lead culture building barista challenges and events

**Who You Are:**
----------------


* Experience building and developing engaging online learning courses and materials
* A keen eye for detail as you create field facing communications
* Customer & employee experience obsessed
* An interest in learning more about coffee and the beverage industry
* Strong multitasker with proven ability to balance multiple priorities
* Excellent communicator, written and verbal
* Proven ability to work cross functionally with multiple departments

**Availability Requirements:**
------------------------------



Full Time: 45 hours per week, 5 days a week. Open to hold education and training classes out of store operating hours


**Benefits:**
-------------


* $70,000-$80,000 annual base salary
	+ *Blank Street, in good faith, believes that the posted salary range is accurate for this role in New York City at the time of posting. Our salaries are rooted in the desire to pay competitively relative to our organization size and industry, reflecting just one part of the total compensation package. Additional components include equity, healthcare benefits, paid time off and various work perks (commuter benefits, free coffee). Details will be discussed during the interview process. Blank Street may pay more or less than the posted range based on factors such as relevant experience and skills, qualifications and location, among others. This range may be modified in the future.*
* Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage. Blank Street covers the full premium for low and mid-tier employee-only plans.
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off + company holidays
* Paid parental leave benefits
* Equity
* Learning and development opportunities. We're growing and we'd like for you to be a part of the journey.
* A whole lot of Blank Street swag & coffee

title: Dental Treatment Coordinator
description:
### **Join the future of dentistry, led by dentists**


*At Dental365, we're reshaping the way patients experience dental care. By placing patients and providers at the core of our approach, we're breaking new ground in the world of dentistry. Since our inception in 2014, we've touched the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients and have emerged as a leading and distinguished dental organization, led by dentists. If you're a motivated change-maker looking to build a lifelong career in dentistry – now is the time to take part in our journey.*


### **At Dental365, our Treatment Coordinators are the champions of our patient experience. Your role extends beyond the front desk, shaping the lasting impression that defines our standard of care.**


### **OUR PRACTICE:**


**Dental Care Princeton**
301 North Harrison Street, Princeton, NJ 08540
### **HIRING SCHEDULE:**


* Sunday: OFF
* Monday: OFF
* Tuesday: 12:00pm - 7:00pm / OFF (alternates)
* Wednesday: 9:00am - 8:00pm
* Thursday: 9:00am - 7:00pm
* Friday: 8:00am - 5:00pm
* Saturday: OFF / 8:00am - 3:00pm (alternates)

### **RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Warmly greet and welcome patients with a high level of concierge care.
* Answering phones promptly and responding to messages.
* Managing schedules - input and confirm patient appointments.
* Entering in new patient records and updating ledgers with precision (Denticon).
* Collect co-payments and verify insurance eligibility (PPO/FFS).
* Respond to patient billing or financial inquiries, directing them to the appropriate departments as needed.
* Assist with various office duties as directed by the Practice Manager.

### **QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Prior dental experience is required.
* A resume showcasing a consistent and stable employment history.
* Exceptional organizational skills to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
* Flexibility to adapt to varying schedules as required.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills.

### **OUR BENEFITS:**


* **Generous Compensation:** We invest in the best and are competitive in our salary offers.
* **Flexible Health and Vision Insurance Plans**: Tailored options for you and your family's well-being.
* **401(K) Retirement Plan with Matching:** Secure your financial future with our employer-matched plan up to 6%.
* **Generous Paid-Time Off:** Accrue up to 3 weeks, plus an annual "you" day for self-care.
* **Exclusive In-house Dental Program**: Heavily discounted services for you and your immediate family.
* **Extra Perks and Fringe Benefits:** Enjoy additional benefits and ongoing perks for our dedicated teams.


* *All benefits available at full-time employment (30+ hours weekly). Some benefits available for part-time employees as well.*


### **Step into a new era with Dental365**


**A modern practice environment designed for superior care and comfort.** We embrace cutting-edge technology in a soothing environment that goes beyond your ordinary dental practice. We've thought through every step in the patient's experience to perfect our communication and care so that each visit is an eagerly anticipated event.


**We're a team that supports your success.** Emphasizing health over sales, we cultivate a warm, supportive culture without the pressure of production quotas. Those motivated for growth in their career are encouraged and supported to reach their full potential.


**Dental365 celebrates diversity.** Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression in terms of all conditions of employment. Our diversity is one of our greatest strengths, and as an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to promote a work environment where all differences are respected.
company_description: Dental365's mission is to exceed expectations, creating tremendous value for our patients’ time and commitment.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
**Job description**

**Overview:**  
Full Time Carpenter/Maintenance Representative for Condominium Management Company with properties based in the Southwestern Region of Connecticut.

**\\*Applicant must be Fairfield County based\\***

The maintenance representative is responsible for preventive, responsive, emergency and routine maintenance throughout properties managed primarily in Fairfield County. Travel to surrounding towns may also be required. Prior property maintenance experience is preferred but not required. Individuals should be able to work independently as well as in a group setting. **Applicants are expected to maintain their own set of hand tools and reliable truck or van.**

**Duties:**

* Overall maintenance of properties. Routine services include but are not limited to, painting, sheet rock repair, cleaning, siding repair, light masonry work, gutter cleaning, light bulb replacements and general carpentry.
* Ensure all maintenance requests are handled in an efficient and professional manner. Provide prompt response to work orders via Smart Phone (provided by employer) email and other applications.

* Respond to and handle emergency situations after hours (when on call).
* Purchase supplies (with company card) when necessary using own vehicle. Arrange for delivery of supplies when necessary. Provide paid receipts with work order detail to office regularly. Maintain own records of same in the event that a purchase is questioned.
* Maintain Maintenance Logs of work completed daily. Provide management with descriptions of work performed daily and track hours worked in accordance with company requirements.
* Be available to staff via email and phone during business hours.
* Reliable personal automobile (fully insured) and basic tools required.

title: Kitchen Staff

We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic individual to join our team as a Kitchen Team Member. title: Store Associate/Cashier
description:
Retail Store Associates play a meaningful role within the CVS Health family. At CVS Health, we’re shaping the future of health care for people, businesses, and communities. With your talents and expertise, you can help us play a more active and supportive role in each person’s unique healthcare needs. Join our team of thousands as we positively impact millions…one customer at a time.

The Retail Store Associate position provides an opportunity, in a leading retail setting, to excel in a growing, high impact, customer focused role, working both independently and as a member of a team, to positively impact the lives of others.

Essential Functions:

* Providing differentiated customer service by anticipating customer needs, demonstrating compassion and care in all interactions, and actively identifying and resolving potential service issues
* Focusing on the customer by giving a warm and friendly greeting, maintaining eye contact and offering help locating additional items, when needed
* Accurately perform cashier duties - handling cash, checks and credit card transactions with precision while following company policies and procedures
* Maintaining the sales floor by restocking shelves, checking in vendors, updating pricing information and completing inventory management tasks as directed by store manager
* Supporting opening and closing store activities, when needed
* Providing customer support to all departments, including photo and beauty, ensuring departments are fully stocked and operational while remaining current with all updated services and tools
* Assisting pharmacy personnel when needed, including working regular shifts in the pharmacy as part of opportunities for growth and career development
* Embracing and advocating for new CVS services and loyalty programs that support our purpose of helping people on their path to better health

Required Qualification

* At least 16 years of age

Physical Requirements:

* Remaining upright on the feet, particularly for sustained periods of time
* Lifting and exerting up to 35 lbs of force occasionally, up to 10 lbs of force frequently, and a negligible amount of force regularly to move objects to and from, including overhead lifting
* Visual Acuity - Having close visual acuity to perform activities such as: viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts/details

Preferred Qualifications

* Previous experience in a retail or customer service setting

Education

* High School diploma or equivalent

**Why CVS Health?**

CVS Health is the leading health solutions company that delivers care in ways no one else can. We help people navigate the health care system — and their personal health care — by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. And we do it all with heart, each and every day. As a CVS Health colleague, you will have a positive impact on millions of people's lives and inspire healthy behaviors in your community.

We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status.

Location: 1775 East Main Street, Mohegan Lake, New York 10547

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $19.00 per hour
company_description: CVS Health is a pharmacy innovation company with a simple and clear purpose: Helping people on their path to better health.
